Summary: Adult with rifle, shotgun, and handgun fired through the windows of the school's church at students who were inside for morning mass
Man with AR-15 rifle fired 30 shots on the street behind the school and then fled in a vehicle
Narrative: Police say the shooting happened just before 1:30 p.m. near the intersection of 29th Street East and Clinton Avenue, directly behind Cristo Rey Jesuit High School in the city’s Phillips neighborhood. Initial reports indicate a suspect stepped out of a vehicle and fired about 30 rounds from a “high-velocity” .223 caliber rifle at a group of people on a sidewalk along Clinton Avenue before getting into a car and fleeing the scene. Of the seven people who were shot, at least one person was “clearly targeted,” O’Hara said.

Summary: Student who was suspended earlier in the day came back to campus and fired shots at the school building
Narrative: Peoria Police Chief Eric Echevarria on Saturday released a statement explaining what authorities believe was the motive for a shooting at Manual High School, which was damaged by the gunfire Friday afternoon. Echevarria acknowledged the incident was “frightening,” but he praised his officers for their quick action, and he pledged to keep a strong police presence at Manual and throughout Peoria Public Schools. The chief said the 15-year-old suspect had been suspended from school earlier in the day, returned with a gun and fired multiple rounds. “Based on what we know, there is no indication that he was aiming at people, only at the structure,” said Echevarria.

Summary: Man shot during dispute in the parking lot during a high school football game
Narrative: A man is injured after a shooting at a high school football game Friday night. In Mayfield, which is in Western Kentucky, shots were fired near War Memorial football stadium. Police found one adult who was transported to a local medical center, then was later flown to Nashville for treatment. Local 6's Drayton Charlton-Perrin was on scene and said Kentucky State Police and other law enforcement had arrived and had cordoned off the site of the shooting. He said he and others on the scene heard a "pop" sound they initially thought was a firecracker.

Summary: Woman arrested after shot fired at the school
Narrative: An investigation is underway for an alleged shooting that took place at a middle school on Wednesday evening. According to MPD, the shooting took place at 5:10 p.m. at Riverview Middle School, located on 241 Majuba Avenue. No injuries have been reported at this time, but MPD has one woman detained. This is an ongoing investigation.

Summary: Student fired shot at school bus after an argument on the bus
Narrative: On Wednesday, officials with the Gulfport Police Department announced the arrest of a 15-year-old on gun charges. Officials say that just after 4 p.m. on Monday, August 18, police were called to the area of Turnberry Avenue and George Street after the 15-year-old allegedly fired a handgun in his bus’s direction. Investigators believe the teen had been in an argument on the bus. After shooting, police say the teen left the scene. The teen is currently charged with the following: Possession of a Handgun on School Property, x1, Shooting at a Vehicle, x1, The teen was taken to be held at the Harrison County Adult Detention Center, where he is being held on a $1,000,000 bond set by Judge Diane Ladner.

Summary: Teacher fatally shot during domestic in school parking lot
Narrative: An employee at the Rockefeller Early Childhood Center in Little Rock was fatally shot in a parking lot just outside the school on Wednesday afternoon, and a man she was in a relationship with was arrested on a capital murder charge in the killing, authorities said. Little Rock police have made an arrest and identified both the victim and suspect after a woman was shot and killed in a parking lot outside the Rockefeller Early Childhood Center on Wednesday afternoon, according to officials. Little Rock police say 29-year-old Duane Nooner was arrested Wednesday evening and is now facing a capital murder charge. The victim has been identified as 36-year-old Michelle Butler of Little Rock. Mayor Frank Scott Jr. confirmed that Butler was an employee of the Little Rock School District. The alleged shooter is in custody, the mayor said. In a statement, Little Rock School District officials called the shooting a tragic, isolated domestic incident that triggered a lockdown of the school.

Summary: Football player fired a shot that hit the school's window after being cut from the football team
Narrative: Parents tell Channel 9 that a football player who had been cut from the team fired a gun at Palisades High School. Those parents told Channel 9’s Glenn Counts that the incident began with an upset athlete. They said they heard that a football player, who had been cut from the team, fired a shot at the school’s building.Charlotte-Mecklenburg Schools (CMS) said police arrested a person Monday after an incident at the school, which cancelled on-campus activities. A person who claims they were on-campus Monday, sent WBTV photos of a shattered school window, which appeared to have a bullet hole in it. However, Charlotte-Mecklenburg Schools has not specified what exactly happened, or whether a gun was fired at a school building. Charlotte-Mecklenburg Schools referred WBTV’s questions to the Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police Department, which didn’t provide information because the case involves a juvenile.

Summary: Shots fired during fight between teens at football game
Narrative: Shots were fired during a football jamboree at Southeast Raleigh High School late Friday night, police said. According to the Raleigh Police Department, the shooting happened during a series of fights that broke out in the parking lot. Police said the event was being attended by multiple high schools.

Summary: Student fired gun into toilet before classes started
Narrative: Watson said the incident came to light on Thursday after administrators learned about a broken toilet in a restroom. School officials said a student admitted to damaging it intentionally. The student was disciplined for the incident. But it was Friday when they learned more information about what happened. "A parent and several students reported that the same student had brought a firearm to school on Thursday and threatened to use it to shoot the toilet," Watson said. "School police immediately investigated and confirmed the student had taken a gun from home, brought it to school, and discharged it in a toilet before classes began." No one else was in the restroom, and no one was injured. The student was arrested and will face charges in the case.

Summary: Parent fatally shot while walking her child to bus stop on the street in front of the school
Narrative: A woman was shot and killed near S. 11th and W. Chestnut streets in Louisville outside Central High School, according to the Louisville Metro Police Department. LMPD said around 8 a.m. at 10th and Chestnut Streets, shots were fired near several people going to school and bus stops. A woman walking a child to school was shot. She was taken to University Hospital where she died.

Summary: Three people shot during fight after basketball tournament
Narrative: The shooting happened around 10:15 p.m. on Thursday, Aug. 7, in the parking lot entrance of the Church Street School at 295 Church St. in White Plains, according to the city's police department. Police said the gunfire followed a dispute among a group of people who had just left an organized basketball event at the nearby Gardella Park. A total of three Bronx residents were injured: an 18-year-old man, a 21-year-old man, and a 22-year-old woman.

Summary: Woman shot during fight in the school parking lot
Narrative: The victim currently lives in North Carolina but previously lived in Vancouver, Wash., according to court documents. She told police her younger sister was involved in an on-going dispute with another woman, so she made arrangements on Instagram to meet in person to fight. She and some of her family met the woman at the elementary school after midnight on July 30. After they physically fought, she and her family got into their car to leave when Sosa-Romero, the other woman’s girlfriend, drew a gun. She fired twice and hit the victim’s foot, court documents state. The victim and her family went to the hospital and Sosa-Romero attempted to flee. Police later located her at Burnt Bridge Creek Elementary, where she was taken into custody.

Summary: Man shot in school parking lot
Narrative:
One person was hospitalized after being shot while walking through a school parking lot in Springfield Monday night, according to a Springfield Police Division report. 
Upon arrival, officers found a male with a single gunshot wound to the lower right leg, according to the report. Officers started to treat the victim by applying a tourniquet, finding an exit wound, and stopping the bleeding.

Summary: Person fatally shot on the school basketball court
Narrative: The teenager, who was 16 years old, was shot near the basketball court on Tuesday, July 15 at Windsor Elementary School in Bertie County. State investigators told WITN that a group of people was playing basketball when a fight erupted and led to the shooting. It is unclear who fired the fatal shot, how old that person was or if they have been charged.

Summary: Teen shot during robbery on the soccer field while a game was taking place
Narrative: A mother who was at the playground with her young kids witnessed the incident. She says the shooter was a young teenager. "He grabbed the gun from a fanny pack and just shot him, and the guy who got shot was like, 'please don't shoot me,' and he shot him," she said. Police say the shooter was on an electric scooter and fled the scene before officers arrived. The witness thought the shooting was over a soccer game dispute, but police say the motive appears to be a robbery.

Summary: Four people shot during alumni picnic
Narrative: 4 people were shot at a class reunion at the Tyner Community Center in Chattanooga Saturday afternoon, police say. One witness told us "all of a sudden gunshots rang out and then you heard gunshots retaliate and then another another set of gunshots, and everybody just hit the ground. All 4 of those who were shot were rushed to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries, according to Chattanooga police.

Summary: Multiple people fired shots during fight at alumni picnic
Narrative: The shooting occurred around 7 p.m. near Woodlawn High School, where an annual alumni picnic was taking place on First Avenue North. Police said the number of rounds fired was in the double digits. A woman, who is believed to have been an innocent bystander, was seriously injured and taken to a hospital by private vehicle. Her condition is currently unknown. Investigators say that preliminary investigative efforts show that two groups of males attending the event got into an argument that led to both groups shooting at each other in a crowded parking lot; around seven cars were shot into.

Summary: Teen shot outside of the school
Narrative: Brockton police say they responded to an area near South Middle School around 7:56 p.m. after receiving reports of a shooting and arrived to find a male teenager with serious injuries. Witnesses told officers that they heard three gunshots and saw several people flee the scene. The 17-year-old victim, whose name was not released, was taken to a Boston hospital. There was no word on any arrests, or the circumstances surrounding the shooting.

Summary: Five teens would when 60 shots were fired during large gathering in the school parking lot
Narrative: Five teens were shot and 10 others hit by vehicles when +60 shots were fired during a large gathering in the parking lot at Mason CLC Elementary in Akron, OH last night. The victims were between 14-21 years old.

Summary: Man fatally shot at front door of school
Narrative: A 29-year-old man was fatally shot outside a Brooklyn public school he attended as a child, as neighborhood Fourth of July fireworks obscured the sound of gunfire, officials and neighbors said. The victim was standing outside the entrance of Public School 174, the Dumont School, on Dumont Ave. near Williams Ave. in Brownsville at about 11:45 p.m. Friday when he was shot in the chest, cops said.

School: Kensington High School for the Creative and Performing Arts
Summary: SRO fatally shot outside school during road rage incident between two drivers
Narrative: Police responded just before 2 a.m. Sunday to the 300 block of North Christopher Columbus Boulevard and found a 68-year-old man inside of his patrol vehicle belonging to the School District of Philadelphia. The victim was shot in the face, arm, and body, according to Inspector DF Pace with the Philadelphia Police Dept. According to Pace, the road rage incident involved two other drivers. A driver in a black Dodge pick-up truck said another driver in a white Hyundai pointed a gun at them. The driver of the pick-up then got off the highway and onto Columbus Boulevard, flagging down the school safety officer to report what happened. “At that point, the officer attempted to investigate or intervene in some way when the occupant of that Hyundai opened fire on that officer. That’s what we believe to be the case,” Pace said. “Based on what we have so far, it does appear the incidents are connected and it does appear the shooting was perpetrated by this person that originally pointed a gun at the driver.” Philadelphia School District officials confirmed the victim was working overnight at Kensington High School for the Creative and Performing Arts, which is operating as a shelter for residents who were impacted by a recent apartment fire.

Summary: Child and teen killed during shooting while on the playground
Narrative: A 4-year-old child was among two people killed in a Friday night shooting at the Skinner Playfield next to Denby High School, according to Detroit Police. The child was shot in the back. An 18-year-old was killed, too. A third victim, 17, was injured but survived. “Kid got jumped on and came back with his crew and shot the park up,” Chief Smith said of the shooting  — another example of the city’s youths turning to guns to settle disputes. Police have not yet confirmed what led to the shooting.

Summary: Shots fired by man with rifle hit the bleachers during sports event
Narrative: According to police, the Santa Fe Regional Communications Center received multiple calls regarding a shooting on the 1500 block of Cerrillos Road. Callers told dispatch they believed they were being shot at as bullets were ricocheting around them while students were attending football practice at Santa Fe Indian School. Santa Fe police say when officers arrived at the area, they found several students taking shelter behind the bleachers of the school's football field. Santa Fe police officers and Bureau of Indian Affairs Police were able to take those students to safety. Police say as they worked to secure the campus, they got a second call reporting that a man on the 1800 block of Otowi Road was shooting a rifle, acting erratically and was suspected of being intoxicated.

Summary: Shots fired during vigal for student who was killed in a shooting
Narrative: Culver City Police Department officers responded to a shots fired call in the area of Culver City High School Tuesday evening with no injuries reported. The call was received at approximately 7:50 p.m. Tuesday when approximately 200-300 people were attending a vigil on the school’s football field, police said.

Summary: SRO's holstered gun fired in the school parking lot injuring the officer
Narrative: A school resource officer was injured Tuesday afternoon when her holstered firearm discharged in the parking lot of a junior high campus in Ceres, authorities said. The incident occurred around 12:50 p.m. at Blaker-Kinser Junior High School, 1601 Kinser Road, according to a news release from the Ceres Police Department. Police said the officer was on campus when her duty weapon discharged while still in its holster, causing a leg injury that was not life-threatening. The discharge is believed to have been caused by a “suspected malfunction,” the department said. The officer was taken to a hospital for treatment. No students or staff were nearby at the time of the incident, and no one else was injured.

Summary: Man fled from police, fired shots at officer, and was fatally shot by officers in the school parking lot
Narrative: Around 10:30 p.m. Monday, two Denver police officers and a DPS safety officer responded to a report of a man and woman standing in front of Kepner Beacon Middle School. While Denver police were looking into if the man or woman had any outstanding warrants for their arrests, the man asked if he could leave. Officers said no, and that's when DPD said he ran off. As officers chased after him, they instructed the man to drop the weapon. He did not and shot a gun at officers. When the two DPD offices and DPS safety officer shot back, they hit the man. He was taken to Denver Health Medical Center & Hospital where he later died from his injuries. No officers were injured.

Summary: Teen shot in the school parking lot during large fight
Narrative: A juvenile was shot during a large brawl that broke out near a high school in San Bernardino County on Wednesday afternoon, causing the school to go on temporary lockdown, police say. A call came in to the Rialto Police Department at 3:15 p.m. reporting a fight between 15 to 20 people. “We were informed by Rialto police about a shooting that occurred near Eisenhower High School’s parking lot,” the Rialto Unified School District said in a statement to KTLA. “The District’s schools are on summer break. However, the school was put on a precautionary lockdown which was lifted shortly after authorities deemed the campus safe.” Police said that a juvenile pulled out a gun during the fight, started shooting and struck another person at least once. Someone else at the scene then drove the victim to the local high school’s parking lot, where police and paramedics responded and began treatment.

Summary: Student shot outside the school at dismissal
Narrative: According to Tacoma Police Department Sgt. John Correa, a staff member at the school called 911 around 2:49 p.m. to report that gunshots were heard in the area. Correa said the staff member did not hear the gunshots, but was advised that someone heard the shots and then called 911. Shortly after, a nearby business called Tacoma police to report “a juvenile victim” had shown up with gunshot wounds, Correa told KOMO News. The shooting happened in front of the school on South 37th Street. Responding officers located the victim on South G Street, which is just around the corner. The boy suffered what Tacoma police described as "non-life-threatening injuries" and was taken to a local hospital. Students still inside the school went on lockdown for 2 hours.

School: Union County Vocational Technical High School
Summary: Teacher was shot by paintballs in the school parking lot
Narrative: A New Jersey teacher pulling out of a high school parking lot was struck with a round fired from a paintball gun last week, authorities said. The teacher was hit in the arm around 5:30 p.m. on June 16 as she left Union County Vocational Technical High School in Scotch Plains in her vehicle, township police said. She suffered pain and bruising but no serious injuries, and reported the incident the next morning. Police are not sure if the shot was fired by someone in a moving vehicle or on foot.

Summary: Teen girl lured adult man to the school parking lot where a teen male fatally shot him
Narrative: Medford police detectives obtained surveillance video from nearby residences and the school, showing that the shooting occurred around 11:30 p.m. Saturday. No calls for service related to suspicious activity or gunshots were received during that time, according to police.  The Southern Oregon High Tech Crimes Task Force collaborated with Medford School District personnel and school resource officers to identify both teen suspects, the release said.  According to police, the investigation revealed that the teen female lured the victim to the location, and the 17-year-old male confronted and shot the victim multiple times before both suspects fled the scene on foot.  Around 2 a.m. Tuesday morning, a Medford police officer located the juvenile male on a bicycle on Hawthorne Street, where he attempted to flee into Hawthorne Park before being apprehended on foot, the release said.  The teen female was arrested shortly thereafter at her residence in the 1500 block of Johnson Street, which is adjacent to Wilson Elementary School.

Summary: Multiple shots fired during fight at graduation
Narrative: Four people are in custody Friday after fights and shots were fired following the graduation ceremony at Burnsville High School. According to the school website, the ceremony was scheduled at the school from 6 to 8 p.m. Burnsville Police says that at 8:30 p.m. they received reports of "multiple altercations" west of the school. When on site, police heard gunshots.No injuries were reported, police said, and four people were taken into custody.

Summary: Teen fired shot into the air during fight at the school
Narrative: The Hawaii Police Department launched a reckless endangerment investigation after reports of a firearm being discharged during a fight on Sunday morning. Police reported that the incident took place on Puohulihuli St. (address of Kealakehe High School). Officers responded to the scene at 12:41 a.m. and found a crowd of 20 people in the area. Witnesses reported that a man brandished a firearm and allegedly fired one round into the air during a physical altercation involving multiple people. Police identified the suspect as 19-year-old Fernando Villanueva-Gonzalez of Kailua-Kona. He was arrested at the scene at approximately 1:05 a.m.

Summary: Man fatally shot on the playground behind the school by two men in ski masks
Narrative: Officers from the 42nd Precinct responded to reports of shots fired near the playground at East 173rd Street, directly across from a Crotona Park West Elementary School in Crotona Park, just before 1 p.m. Upon arrival, officers found a man with a gunshot wound to the head. EMS responded and pronounced the victim dead at the scene. He has not yet been identified, police said. Police said they are reviewing nearby security camera footage to identify a suspect. The investigation is ongoing, and no arrests have been made. The NYPD has yet to confirm reports that officers are searching for two masked suspects who were last seen fleeing toward Indian Lake
Accomplice_Narrative: Two men in ski masks fled

Wayzata High School father jumps into action amid post graduation shooting outside Mariucci Arena - YouTube
Summary: Two people shot during fight at graduation ceremony
Narrative: A suspect was in custody Friday night after shots were fired outside 3M Arena at Mariucci at the University of Minnesota just as people were leaving the graduation ceremony for Wayzata High School, authorities said. According to the University of Minnesota Department of Public Safety, the shooting happened at about 8:20 p.m. An emergency alert sent out by the U advised people to stay away from the area, but authorities said late Friday that there was no ongoing threat.

School: Martin Luther King Jr. High School
Summary: 20 shots fired during fight at prom between teens in the school parking lot
Narrative: Police in Detroit are investigating a shooting that happened Thursday night near Martin Luther King Jr. High School. The incident happened around 8:26 p.m. Thursday in the 3200 block of East Lafayette, when police say a suspect or suspects fired shots in the high school's parking lot. Several teenagers were in the parking lot at the time of the shooting. No one was injured in the shooting, but police are looking to speak to a person of interest who they say was in the area at the time of the shooting.  igh school students gussied up in their dresses and suits were celebrating their prom at a Detroit high school when shots rang out. Police are now looking for the man accused of firing approximately 20 rounds on Detroit's east side.

Summary: Teens fired shots in parking lot and attempted to hide gun inside the school
Narrative: Today at around 12:10 p.m., Vancouver Police responded to 4100 Plomondon Street for reports of a drive-by shooting in the parking lot. The investigation indicated that an altercation occurred between several individuals in the parking lot, with an unknown male shooting several rounds from a vehicle before driving off. There were no injuries reported. Officers located three shell casings in the parking lot. Roosevelt Elementary School was briefly in secure response while police investigated. During the investigation, officers learned one of the juveniles in the parking lot retreated into the school, concealing a handgun wrapped in a sweatshirt. Video surveillance revealed that the juvenile handed the sweatshirt/handgun off to another juvenile, who attempted to conceal it inside the school. Officers located the sweatshirt inside the school with the stolen handgun. One 15-year-old male and one 17-year-old male were booked into the juvenile detention center for Unlawful Possession of a Firearm II, Possession of a Stolen Firearm, and Possession of a Dangerous Weapon on School Grounds.

Summary: Teen wounded when 24 shots were fired outside the school
Narrative: A 17-year-old was hospitalized after being shot at the I Promise School on May 24, Akron police Lt. Michael Murphy reported in a news release. Officers responded the reports of the shooting at about 3:27 p.m., discovering that the teenage victim had been transported to the hospital by an individual on the scene. The extent of the injuries are unknown. Officers reportedly recovered nearly two dozen shell casings from the scene. The Major Crimes Unit and CrimeScene Unit detectives also responded to the scene.

Summary: 7-year-old fired replica glock pistol at the school breaking two windows and causing a lockdown
Narrative: On Thursday, Pierce County Sheriff's Office deputies were sent to Brookdale Elementary School after reports of shots fired and two windows shattered. The school, located at 611 132nd St S, was placed on lockdown as deputies investigated the incident. Investigators determined the shots came from a nearby home, where a 7-year-old boy had fired a compressed air BB gun Glock replica toward the school. The child had received the gun as a gift from a family member, who believed it to be a toy. The Pierce County Sheriff's Office expressed concern over the increasing presence of high-velocity CO2 cartridge BB guns, which they emphasize are not toys and should not be in the hands of children.

Summary: Woman shot in the school parking lot by a group of teens, suspected identified by SRO, school went on lockdown for more than an hour
Narrative: City police said in a news release that officers were called about 8:40 a.m. to the area of 18th and Chew streets for a report of a shooting. Investigators found the woman who was shot and provided aid to her before an ambulance took her to a nearby hospital. Lehigh County District Attorney Gavin Holihan said in a news release that the woman was shot in the leg. During the investigation police identified two suspects who fired at each other, both of whom were found and detained, according to the release. Both are adults; they have not yet been publicly identified. There was an immediate response from law enforcement, including school resource officers from Allen High School, to the shooting. A person of interest was identified and detained within minutes of the first 911 call, the DA said. An Allentown School District spokesperson said Allen High School and Raub Middle School were briefly placed on a perimeter lockdown because of police activity nearby. She said just before 10 a.m. that the lockdown was lifted, and that classes resumed.

Summary: 20 shots fired and man killed next to elementary school track meet
Narrative: According to DC Police, the shooting happened in the 800 block of 26th Street Northeast, near Charles Young Elementary School and the former Spingarn High School. Spingarn, which closed in 2013 due to low enrollment, is sometimes used by nearby schools for track meets and other sports events. The shots rang out as a championship track meet for 4th and 5th graders started to get underway at Spingarn. The shooting sent the children, parents and coaches running for cover. "Everyone was crying and people were having panic attacks," one young girl said. One parent described the scene as chaotic and heard more than 20 shots go off. The meet, part of the DC Interscholastic Athletics Association's Elementary Track Championship, was cancelled. DC Police Chief Pamela Smith said a man was found unconscious and not breathing, and while life-saving measures were attempted, the victim died at the scene.

Summary: Man fired shot near playground while students were outside for recess
Narrative: A man suspected of firing shots at Goyne Park near Ecoff Elementary School was arrested by U.S. Marshals at a hotel in Chester on Wednesday. Police confirmed to CBS 6 that Takhi Zhaki Johnson Sr. is charged with reckless handling of a firearm and shooting a firearm within 1,000 feet of a school. The shots were fired on Tuesday, which prompted a brief lock down at the school. Police said the shooting was domestic in nature and the proximity to the school was coincidental.

Summary: 17-year-old fatally shot in school parking lot during attempted robbery, three teens involved had guns
Narrative: A 17-year-old boy was fatally shot in the Kearns High School parking lot early Sunday during what police described as a robbery gone wrong. The seller had reportedly showed up at the parking lot to sell champagne bottles. Sgt. Cutler said two individuals with guns exited the vehicle. The 18-year-old went to retrieve a gun from his own vehicle. As he did so, one of the suspects — a 17-year-old — approached and pointed a gun at him. The 18-year-old fired his weapon while running away, striking the 17-year-old. The 18-year-old then flagged down responding officers. The 17-year-old was transported to a nearby hospital, where he later died from his injuries.
Accomplice_Narrative: Two armed teens in group of 4 attempted robbery

Summary: School security guard accidentally fired gun inside bathroom
Narrative: A Paramus school security guard accidentally discharged his weapon inside Midland Elementary School, Superintendent Sean Adams said in a letter to the community. The security guard was inside a single-use, staff-only bathroom at the time of the incident, Adams said. "While we are profoundly relieved that no one was injured, this event is extremely concerning and completely unacceptable," Adams said. The guard has been "placed on leave, with any additional recommended action to be reviewed by the Board at its upcoming meeting on Monday, May 19," the superintendent wrote in his letter.

Summary: Shots fired in the parking lot during high school graduation
Narrative: The St. Louis Public School District said that several suspects opened fire on a vehicle in a parking lot near Harris-Stowe State University, which is where Sumner High School’s graduation ceremony was held. The district said that no one was injured in the incident that happened around 4 p.m.

Summary: BB pellet broke school bus window while driving students home at dismissal
Narrative: The incident occurred at about 3:45 p.m. as the bus was driving on Oakwood Avenue, according to police. The bus driver reported hearing a crack from outside the bus before noticing that the first passenger side window was cracked and had a small circle in the corner, authorities said. During an investigation, police allegedly found a fragment of a BB projectile inside the bus. No injuries were reported.

Summary: Teen killed and another teen wounded when 38 shots were fired at them on the school's outdoor basketball court
Narrative: An 18-year-old was killed and a 17-year-old was injured following a double shooting near the area of James Logan Elementary School in Northwest Philadelphia, police said. The 18-year-old victim was shot several times in his chest and torso on May 15, according to Philadelphia Police Chief Inspector Scott Small. The teenager was taken to a nearby hospital where he was pronounced dead just after 6:30 p.m. The 17-year-old was shot in the hand and leg and has been taken to the hospital, police said. He is in stable condition.

Summary: Student shot during fight at dismissal
Narrative: At 3:19 p.m., the 17-year-old boy was inside a vehicle in the 5900 block of North California Avenue, just south of Peterson Avenue, when someone approached and shot him, police said. The victim was taken to NorthShore Evanston Hospital in good condition, police said. The office of Ald. Andre Vasquez (40th) said Lincoln District police have confirmed the victim was a Mather High School student. Mather Park is located on the west side of the block of California Avenue where the shooting happened. Basketball courts and other athletic spaces for the park are located along California Avenue at Thorndale Avenue. Vasquez reported the Chicago Public Schools crisis team would be on site Wednesday to support Mather students, and Chicago Police will be present at school dismissal time until further notice.

Summary: 14-year-old fired shots into a crowd of students during a fight, 16-year-old bystander fatally shot
Narrative: A 16-year-old girl was pronounced dead after being shot in the head near Bronx Latin School on Monday in the Morrisania section around 5 p.m. Video recovered from a school camera shows children leaving the school yard and entering an alley alongside the building. Officials say the video shows a fight break out between a group of kids gathered in the alley. They say a 14-year-old boy, wearing a white t-shirt and shorts, is punched in the face and knocked to the ground by another male, wearing a grey hoodie. At some point, someone slips the 14-year-old a pistol, who then fires three shots into the crowd, hitting 16-year-old Evette Jeffrey in the head. Police say Jeffrey was riding from the school yard on a scooter, and was an innocent bystander. Police sources say the NYPD is still looking for a 13-year-old accused of handing the alleged shooter the gun.
Accomplice_Narrative: shooter given pistol by a 13-year-old student

Summary: Man fatally shot by a teen on the school baseball field during a robbery attempt
Narrative: Authorities were notified of the shooting by someone in a vehicle traveling on Texas Street. They said they were able to locate the vehicle off Red Oak Road near Texas Street. When police caught up with the vehicle, they said they discovered the victim with a single gunshot wound to the chest, the suspect, and another passenger. Police said the suspect was the driver of the vehicle. Emergency workers arrived on the scene not long after law enforcement and immediately loaded the victim into an ambulance. They rushed him to a hospital, which is where he later died from his injuries. Through an investigation, police determined the actual shooting took place at the Doyle High School baseball field.

Summary: Teen's body was found next to classroom as students arrived for school
Narrative: According to an SAPD sergeant on scene, officers searching for an 18-year-old man who lived in the area discovered his body near a portable classroom building on campus. The sergeant also said they found a gun nearby. Police said the man’s family had made a call for a welfare check around 6 a.m. after they noticed he had left home and a gun was missing. About an hour later, officers located his body at the school, just as students and parents had begun to arrive.

Summary: Parent got onto the school bus with a gun and threatened the driver during student dropoff
Narrative: On May 7, 2025, about 3:30 p.m., a person told officers that he was dropping children off from school in the area of Scorpio Lane and Crystal Lake Drive in the Surfside Beach area, a police report said. Ingram was standing at one of the stops. After the children exited the bus, the suspect gets on the bus and proceeds to start yelling at what appears from the report to be the bus driver and the children. Security footage shows the bus driver getting up out of the driver seat and advising the suspect multiple times to exit the bus. However, the suspect refused, the report said. Horry County spokesperson Lisa Bourcier said by email that the man was an upset family member of a student. He got on the school bus during the afternoon drop-off, prompting the bus driver to ask him to leave and call police.

Summary: Bullet fired off campus hit the school building and struck a pipe inside the school which flooded the cafeteria
Narrative: Water cascaded down the side of the cafeteria at Lockwood Steam Academy in East Oakland early Wednesday after a bullet from a nearby shooting ended up in a pipe, officials said. "One of those bullets entered our building, the cafeteria here, and it pierced a pipe and caused a flood," said John Sasaki, spokesman for the Oakland Unified School District. The cafeteria had recently been remodeled, but Sasaki said the damage was limited, thanks to firefighters who noticed the flowing water.

Summary: Student shot in front of the school at dismissal
Narrative: Gunfire erupted during a large fight that her son was involved in with other students. The shooting left her son's 14-year-old classmate wounded. The teen was in the street in the 300-block of East 37th Street about 3:20 p.m. near Wendell Phillips Academy High School in Bronzeville when a suspect approached and fired shots, police said. The boy was shot in the leg, and he was taken to Insight Hospital in fair condition, CPD said.

Summary: Student shot on school bus parked outside of the school during dismissal
Narrative: Officials say at 2:45 p.m. a student suffered a non-fatal gunshot wound inside a school bus in front of Thurston High School. The school says the victim was shot in the hand. Redford police say the student was taken to the hospital and is expected to be okay. Police were called to the high school on Wednesday afternoon on reports of a shooting. When officers arrived, they found a 15-year-old boy suffering a gunshot wound to his hand after being shot on a bus outside the school. During their investigation, police learned that a teen boy had brought a gun to the school and had it unsecured in his backpack. While on the bus, he took the gun out of his backpack and was handling it, leading to the weapon being fired and hitting another student. The teen who had the gun is charged with carrying a concealed weapon, careless discharge of a weapon causing injury, and possession of a weapon in a weapons-free school zone. The female relative has been charged with the felony violation of the Firearms Safe Storage law involving a minor obtaining access to an unsecured/unlocked firearm and firing it, causing injury.

Summary: Officer shot while breaking up large fight at dismissal
Narrative: A Philadelphia police officer is in critically condition after being shot during a large fight outside Overbrook High School at dismissal. At 2:45pm yesterday, officers called for backup to break-up a fight between dozens of students. During the fight, a 30-year-old man fired a AR-style pistol. A rifle caliber round ricocheted off the ground and stuck under an officer's vest. In a statement, the School District of Philadelphia expressed its well wishes for the injured officer and said all after-school programming would be canceled.

Summary: Man fired shots during physical altercation with school security guard
Narrative: Police responded to the area around 10 a.m. for a report of shots fired. As an Allentown School District security officer and a witness were showing police where the shots were fired, a man — identified as Nieves — emerged and started fighting with the security officer, according to a news release from Allentown police Capt. Daniel Gross. During the altercation, Nieves pointed a gun at the school security officer. When Nieves saw police officers, he ran away and discarded the gun, Gross said. Nieves was apprehended by police a short time later, and the gun was recovered, Gross said. Nieves is charged with aggravated assault, simple assault, terroristic threats, carrying a concealed firearm without a license and evading arrest.

Summary: 15-year-old shot behind the baseball field bleachers, school went on lockdown
Narrative: Reedley Police say they responded to the 900 block of E. El Dorado Ave. around 11:35 a.m. after receiving multiple calls regarding a shooting. When officers arrived, they say they found a male juvenile suffering from multiple gunshot wounds. He was initially transported to Adventist Hospital in Reedley, but was later transferred to Community Regional Medical Center for further treatment. According to police, witnesses in the area reported seeing two male suspects fleeing the area on foot.

Summary: Teen shot in the school parking during a dispute
Narrative: On Thursday, just before 8 p.m., officers were called to Carver High School, located at 3545 Carver School Road. Officials said the gunshots were fired in the parking lot of the school and two vehicles were hit. Police said there was a disturbance involving several people that escalated before the shooting occurred. Officers said a juvenile arrived at a local hospital with a non-life-threatening gunshot wound. Police said John Bekham Panzo, 18, was arrested and charged in connection with the shooting.

Summary: Teens fired shot at a person in the parking lot, shots missed and struck the school
Narrative: According to detectives, the shooting happened on May 1 in the 700 block of 26th Street Northeast. Just before 4:30 p.m., the three suspects were in a parking lot of a school. They shot toward another person who was near the school and then took off in a vehicle. No one was hurt in the shooting, but the school was damaged, police said.

Summary: Teen fired shot during a fight
Narrative: The Rolling Meadows Police Department received a report of the shooting on Wednesday several hours after it occurred during a fight between two juveniles near the school campus. No injuries were reported as a result of the gunfire. Following an overnight investigation, detectives identified the suspect and recovered the gun used. The juvenile, who has not been identified now faces multiple charges, including aggravated battery and unlawful use of a weapon.

Summary: Two students fired handguns in the field behind the school, school locked down
Narrative: Aldine ISD said police activity near Eisenhower Senior High School prompted the lockdown at about 7:20 a.m. Police in the area observed the three people shooting in the bayou and then fleeing toward the school. Two Eisenhower High School students are in custody after police say they fired a gun near campus Wednesday morning.

Summary: Gun fired inside students backpack inside bathroom
Narrative: No one was injured in the incident. The school's principal described the morning incident as a student discharge of a "possible" firearm inside a classroom. The student then fled the campus, according to police. The alarming incident comes barely a month after a student reportedly brought a gun to school in nearby Manhattan Beach. The student involved was a 13-year-old boy, The Los Angeles Times reported. The gun apparently went off accidentally, possibly inside a backpack, shortly after the morning bell, the paper reported.

Summary: Student shot in the school parking lot
Narrative: Student was shot by a student with a .22 handgun in the school parking lot. Three students were found with handguns. Richland County School District said in a statement that the student was injured after an airsoft pistol was fired at Ridge View High School’s campus. According to a statement sent to parents by the school’s principal, a student was injured while in a car after another fired an airsoft pistol on campus. The student's hospital records show the injury was from a bullet not a BB. Per a lawsuit, The airsoft pistol assertion was a "spin campaign" from the school's staff aimed at downplaying the severity of the incident, according to the lawsuit filed on May 12. The suit seeks damages from claims of negligence against the district, the student who fired the gun and that student's parents. In the lawsuit's account of the shooting, the bullet went through the student's jacket and hit him in the abdomen, leaving metal fragments. Those fragments were left alone after it was deemed more dangerous to remove them, according to the suit. Mobley told The Post and Courier that the student's paperwork from the hospital reported the injury as a "possible gunshot wound or BB gun" and said there wasn't an exit wound. The alleged gunshot, described as a negligent discharge, came through the window of a car the student was standing near, according to the lawsuit. All three of the car's occupants were students, and all three had handguns, the suit alleges, but there was no altercation or conflict in the lead-up to the incident.

Summary: Man fatally shot behind the school
Narrative: A 39-year-old man was found dead early Wednesday morning near a high school in Taunton, officials said. Stephan Myers, of Falmouth, was found in a construction area behind Bristol-Plymouth Regional Technical School, the Bristol County District Attorney announced Wednesday. He died from a single gunshot wound, the DA said. Foul play is suspected, but there is no ongoing threat to the community or any known connection to the high school, the DA said.

Summary: Student fired shots near front door following fight between multiple students
Narrative: A student fired shots near front door following fight between multiple students. The shooter fled before police arrived. The campus was locked down for multiple hours before students were released to their parents.

Summary: Three men in ski masks opened fire killing two students at dismissal, school placed on lockdown
Narrative: Memphis Police responded to a shooting on Mississippi Boulevard near South Lauderdale Street, steps away from Booker T. Washington High School, at 3 p.m. Thursday. According to Deputy Chief Webb Kirkdoffer, two male students were pronounced dead on the scene. Memphis Police did not give the ages of the victims. Booker T. Washington High School was placed on lockdown. Kirkdoffer says that police were able to communicate with the school, and the lockdown was later lifted. A witness told WREG he saw three men in ski masks with automatic rifles chasing someone. Shots were fired, and a crowd scattered. The witness said the suspects shot the individual six to 10 times, then came back and fired more shots.
Accomplice_Narrative: Three men in masks with rifles

Summary: Shots fired during drive-by shooting broke school window, lockdown, after school events cancelled
Narrative: Washington School, a private school offering pre-school, elementary, middle and college preparatory, said there was a shooting at an apartment complex near the campus on E Reed Road Wednesday. Officials said a few stray bullets hit windows in a building in an area where there were no students. The campus was placed on lockdown for approximately 30 minutes. Out of an abundance of caution, all after-school practices were cancelled, and a track meet has been re-scheduled for Saturday.

Summary: Teen fatally shot in front of the school
Narrative: Detectives from the NYPD’s 104th Precinct are searching for a group of suspects who allegedly shot and killed a teenager in front of a school in Ridgewood on Tuesday evening. The incident occurred just before 5:45 p.m. on April 22 in front of 17-26 George St., outside Joseph F. Quinn Intermediate School 77. Paramedics rushed Hernandez to Brookdale Hospital, where he was initially listed in critical condition. He later succumbed to his injuries. A law enforcement source familiar with the investigation said the suspects were a group of males who fled the scene on foot in an unknown direction. No arrests have been made and the investigation remains ongoing.

Summary: 11-year-old shot in front of the school
Narrative: An 11-year-old is in the hospital after a shooting in Suisun City Tuesday evening. It's not clear what led up to the shooting, however police said the 11-year-old child was being treated at a hospital. The Fairfield-Suisun Unified School District provided the following statement to ABC10. "We are aware of reports of a shooting that occurred near Crystal Middle School this evening, after school hours. At this time, we have no information confirming whether the individual involved is a student from Fairfield-Suisun Unified. We are in communication with local law enforcement as they investigate the situation. The safety and well-being of our students and staff is our top priority, and we will provide updates if more information becomes available."

Summary: SRO accidentally fired gun inside the school, no students injured
Narrative: A student resource officer at Peach County High School accidentally fired his gun while preparing for duty Friday morning, according to the Peach County Sheriff's Office and the Peach County Board of Education. It happened at the high school this morning in an area "restricted from students," according to an announcement shared with parents. The district says no one was hurt and there was no disruption to school activity.

Summary: Man shot in the school owned park, school went on lockdown
Narrative: According to a press release, at approximately 2:00 p.m. Senior Officer Ren Johnson and Detective Ross Richey responded to the audible sounds of a shooting near Renaissance Academy. Upon arrival, officers found a male victim with a gunshot wound to the calf in the 800 block of East Whitner Street. An Anderson University student said the school was on lockdown for about 15 minutes. At approximately 3:30 p.m., about an hour after the initial report, Anderson University Campus Safety lifted the lockdown after receiving confirmation from the Anderson County Sheriff’s Office that any potential threat had subsided.

Summary: Student shot during large fight at dismissal
Narrative: The shooting happened around 4:15 p.m., just after class was let out at Chicago Vocational High School in the Calumet Heights neighborhood. Chicago police say the teen, who attends the nearby Sullivan House High School, was on the sidewalk when a van pulled up, and someone inside started shooting. Unclear if the victim was a bystander or involved in the fight.

Summary: Three students shot and another student injured when student opened fire inside classroom
Narrative: The student who shot four students when he opened fire at a Dallas high school this week was in and out of the building in less than two minutes and is believed to have been targeting a specific student, the school district police chief said Thursday. The suspect parked his vehicle at the school just before 1 p.m., Martinez said. An arrest warrant said that after the suspect was let into the building, he walked down a hallway until he spotted a group of students. The arrest warrant says he then displayed a firearm and began firing “indiscriminately” before approaching a student who was not able to run and walking toward that student and appearing to take a point-blank shot. Five of the students ranged in age from 15 to 18, and all were injured by gunfire. The age of the six, who suffered a “musculoskeletal injury to the lower body,” was not immediately known. Dallas Independent School District Superintendent Stephanie Elizalde said at a news conference that a teacher in the classroom directed the suspect away from the school, preventing the situation from escalating. Shooter fled before police arrived and turned himself in overnight. Classes are cancelled for the remainder of the school week. A student was also shot inside the same school in April 2024.
Accomplice_Narrative: Second studend opened side door to let student with gun inside

Summary: Maintenance worker found 2 guns near the electrical room, one fired when he picked it up
Narrative: Turlock Police Department officials report that on Monday morning at approximately 10:30 a.m., a Turlock Unified School District maintenance worker discovered a pile consisting of two blankets and a jacket near a fence line on the Dutcher Middle School campus. The items were found in a maintenance area where electrical equipment is housed, near a neighboring apartment complex. While clearing the space, a firearm within the pile discharged. Fortunately, no one was injured. The incident was immediately reported, and several Turlock Police Department officers arrived at the campus within minutes to secure the area and begin the investigation. A School Resource Officer also responded shortly after to assist. Two handguns and a jacket were located and recovered. All items were collected and booked into evidence. At this time, it is unclear how long the firearms had been there or how they ended up in that location. Staff are currently reviewing surveillance footage and working to determine a timeline.

Summary: 13-year-old and 17-year-old shot in front of the building
Narrative: Two boys, a 12-year-old and a 17-year-old , are recovering after a shooting in front of the shared campus of Thomas P. Ryan Recreation Center and School 33. The shooting happened shortly after 5 p.m. on Monday. Both boys were taken to the hospital, and investigators said they are expected to survive. Shooter fled.

Summary: Two people shot in front of the school, classes cancelled
Narrative: Two victim were shot in front of the school during the early morning before campus opened. Blood stains were visible on the sidewalk by the front door when news crews arrived. Classes were cancelled due to the ongoing police investigation.

Summary: Woman shot another woman during an argument in front of the school
Narrative: Officers responded to the Little Village neighborhood's 4300-block of West 25th Place just after 6:30 p.m. Police said a 39-year-old woman was involved in an altercation with another woman on the street outside Corkery Elementary School after a crash two blocks away. That's when that person took out a gun and fired shots at the victim, striking her in the abdomen and buttocks, police said.

Summary: Man fired shot into the air in the school parking lot
Narrative: According to the Riverside Police Department, officers were called out on reports of suspicious individual in the area of Burkhardt Road near St. Helen Catholic School on the morning of April 11. When officers arrived on scene, witnesses told them that a suspect had fired a single gunshot into the air while driving away from the school parking lot. Investigation revealed the suspect had been confronted by another individual regarding his “erratic driving” near the school, prompting the firearm discharge. Wanted on charges for Improperly Discharging a Firearm with Intent to Cause Harm or Panic to Persons In A School Zone.

Summary: Explled student shot during fight on the playground during morning classes
Narrative: A teen girl was shot on the playground next to the Overton High School athletic fields Thursday morning, according to the Memphis Police Department (MPD).  An MPD spokesperson said that the girl was fighting with other people at Willow Road Park when a man in a dark-colored SUV pulled up and fired shots. Investigators found two shell casings at the scene. Police said the girl suffered critical injuries in the shooting and that she was rushed to Regional One Health. The shooting prompted a lockdown at nearby Overton High School. A spokesperson for the Memphis-Shelby County Schools District identified the injured girl as a previous Overton High student. According to the school district's spokesperson, the girl was expelled from the school in 2023.

Summary: Staff member shot himself in the leg in the hallway with students around
Narrative: On April 10, 2025, at approximately 7:02 a.m., troopers responded to a report of a shooting at ASPIRA Charter High School, located at 750 Otts Chapel Road, Newark. Upon arriving, troopers discovered that a 41-year-old man, who was a school bus driver and member of the Culture & Climate Team, had sustained a gunshot wound to the leg after his firearm, which was concealed in his clothing, accidentally discharged while inside the school. A preliminary investigation indicates that the firearm, which was concealed in the school employee’s waistband, discharged unintentionally due to how it was handled or manipulated. The incident took place in a school hallway while children and staff members were present. Fortunately, no one else was injured. The school’s constable rendered aid to the school employee, who was ultimately transported to an area hospital by EMS.

Summary: Gun inside students backpack fired inside the classroom
Narrative: A 9-year-old student at Billingsley Elementary School accidentally discharged a loaded Kimber K6s .357 Magnum revolver in a classroom on April 9, 2025, at approximately 10:24 a.m., leading to an early dismissal and a one-day school closure. No injuries were reported, and authorities are investigating how the child obtained the firearm. The incident occurred when the student, seated at a desk, reached into their backpack to retrieve a piece of paper. The backpack was positioned between their legs, and the revolver discharged, with the projectile striking the ground. The classroom teacher and a nearby school resource officer (SRO) responded immediately, securing the Kimber K6s .357 Magnum and ensuring the safety of all students. Preliminary findings suggest the revolver may belong to a relative visiting the student’s family. The Charles County Sheriff’s Office, led by Cpl. J. Brown, is examining how the student came into possession of the firearm and why it was in their backpack. Upon completion, the case will be forwarded to the Charles County State’s Attorney’s Office for review.

Summary: Two teens threated a student with a gun in the school parking lot
Narrative: The Wahpeton Police Department says after 4:00pm on Wednesday April 9th, they were called to the Wahpeton High School parking lot, for a report that two males were threatening a student with a gun. Police say two days after the report was made, 18-year-old James Johnson and 18-year-old Tyler Ryan were booked into the Cass County Jail for terrorizing.

Summary: Two students shot in school parking lot during dismissal
Narrative: HISD Police Chief Shamara Garner says the students were dismissed from school at about 4:30 p.m., so about 150 students were still in the area. Police directed back into the building, and they went into lockdown. According to Chief Garner, a black four-door Tahoe was following two brothers who were walking east on Beverly Hill Street. The Tahoe was parked in the school parking lot, then exited and started to slowly drive behind the brothers. When the brothers reached the intersection at Unity Drive, police say a suspect got out of the vehicle and shot at the brothers. One of the brothers, who is not a student at the school, ran from the scene. The other brother, a 16-year-old sophomore, ran back toward the school, but was grazed on his knee in the shooting. A bystander, an 18-year-old junior, was shot in her shoulder. Both students are expected to recover.

Summary: Student shot on the campus prior to dismissal
Narrative: Student from the neighboring middle school was shot on the elementary school campus by another middle school student during afternoon classes. Parents were not notified until the following day and the campus was not locked down. Police apprehended the shooter and the victim was transported to the hospital. Shooting took place on the school playground 20 minutes prior to dismissal.

Summary: Man entered locked door behind staff member, said he had a medical emergency then pulled gun, subdued by staff
Narrative: According to the New Orleans Police Department, a man entered ReNEW Dolores T. Aaron Academy behind an employee. The man entered the foyer and told the employee he was having a medical emergency and pulled out a gun. According to Tanya Bryant, the CEO of ReNEW schools, employees were able to grab the gun from the man. Bryant said at some point, the man ran and entered a classroom but was unarmed. According to Bryant, the man startled the students, but no one was hurt in the incident. Bryant said employees were able to detain the man until NOPD arrived at the scene.

Summary: Juvenile shot another juvenile outside of the school
Narrative: Deputies with the King County Sheriff's Office responded to a shooting near a King County middle school Tuesday afternoon. It happened at South 360th Street and 32nd Avenue South, which is where Sequoyah Middle School is located. Detectives say one juvenile shot another juvenile. The victim was taken to Harborview Medical Center and has non-life-threatening injuries.

Summary: Handgun fired inside 3rd grade student's backpack when student reached inside for snacks
Narrative: A gun inside a third-grader’s backpack went off in a classroom in Spotsylvania County, Virginia, on Monday morning, authorities say. No students or staff were hurt after the gunfire at Lee Hill Elementary School, the county sheriff’s office said. The handgun fired at about 10:50 a.m., the office said in a statement. “Once the gun discharged, the teacher evacuated all 26 students from the classroom and notified the School Resource Officer who was on site,” the statement said. The student had no intent to do harm, the sheriff’s office said after conducting initial interviews. Detectives are continuing to interview the student and the student’s parents. “It was during snack time, and the child reached into his bookbag to retrieve his snacks and inadvertently pulled the trigger of the weapon,” Maj. Liz Scott with the sheriff’s office told WTOP. “It’s truly remarkable that nobody was physically injured.” Both 36-year-old Ciara Armstead and 34-year-old Terrence Carroll Jr. were charged with one felony and one misdemeanor related to endangering a child. Their son is not facing any charges.

Summary: Shot fired into chapel during morning prayer
Narrative: This morning, a bullet penetrated the wall of our school chapel shortly before our regularly scheduled morning prayer. We are deeply grateful to report that no one was injured. As a precaution, all students are currently being held safely in the gym. For everyone’s safety, while the investigation is ongoing, students will be permitted to leave with a parent or guardian, students who drove will only be released with parental consent, and no student will be allowed to walk home.

School: Saints Peter and Paul Catholic Church School
Summary: Man fatally shot priest while students were outside for recess
Narrative: School was still in session Thursday before 3 p.m. Just behind the rectory, the fourth graders at Saints Peter and Paul Catholic School were outside playing during recess when they heard as many as four gunshots. Students heard the blasts through the school windows. On the ground, at the front of the rectory, the Rev. Raj “Arul” Balaswamy Carasala — the church’s priest for 14 years, a man originally from India who played dodgeball with the kids and high-fived them even after losing — lay bleeding. Betty Haug was in her back yard, her husband Mike Haug said, when she peered across the way and saw the alleged shooter, Gary Lee Hermesch, 66, of Tulsa but formerly from Nemaha County, turn his weapon on the priest and fire. Sheriff’s deputies and officers with the Seneca Police Department later arrested Gary Hermesch of Tulsa, Oklahoma. Hermesch, 66, was charged Friday and held in the Nemaha County Jail in lieu of $1 million bond, County Attorney Brad Lippert said Friday in a written statement. The charging complaint says that Hermesch “intentionally and with premeditation” killed Carasala, Lippert said.

Summary: Man fired AR-15 rifle in front of school before high speed chase with police
Narrative: A federal grand jury returned an indictment today charging a previously convicted felon with gun charges after he allegedly possessed and discharged an AR-15 style rifle within a school zone. The defendant is restricted from possessing firearms and ammunition. According to court documents, on April 2, 2025, South Salt Lake City Police Department officers responded to a call of shots fired at Granite Park Junior High School in South Salt Lake, Utah, at 7:15 p.m. After officers arrived, they discovered AR-15 style shell casings in the middle of the road near the school. Surveillance cameras, provided by Granite School District law enforcement, captured the suspect’s vehicle, a Subaru WRX. Shortly after, a Utah Highway Patrol trooper observed a Subaru WRX speeding more than 100 miles per hour near 6000 South and I-15. UHP attempted to conduct a traffic stop, but the driver, later identified as Moffitt, fled and continued speeding up to 130 miles per hour before exiting Redwood Road and I-215 in Taylorsville. The pursuit was terminated. A run of the vehicles license plate showed the vehicle was registered to Moffitt. UHP troopers responded to the address on the vehicle’s registration and while troopers were working to make contact with Moffit, multiple shots were fired from inside the residence. A witness inside the home advised law enforcement Moffitt had a rifle. Moffitt eventually opened the garage door and fled in the Subaru. A Taylorsville City Police Department Officer intercepted and crashed into Moffitt’s Subaru, disabling the vehicle. Moffit was taken into custody. Officers seized an AR-15 style rifle with a drum magazine and ammunition from inside the vehicle. Moffitt is charged with felon in possession of a firearm, possession of a firearm within a school zone, and discharge of a firearm within a school zone. His initial appearance on the indictment is scheduled for April 17, 2025, at 1:30 p.m. in courtroom 8.4 before a U.S. Magistrate Judge at the Orrin G. Hatch United States District Courthouse in downtown Salt Lake City.

Summary: Two students arrested for pointing and threatening student with a replica gun
Narrative:
Police responded to calls to Valley Stream North High School Wednesday morning after a 14-year-old boy and 17-year-old boy were found with the alleged gun.
Police say the 17-year-old allegedly pointed the BB gun at two students.
The 14-year-old is facing a weapons charge and is due in court later this month. The 17-year-old will face a judge today in family court. He is facing weapons and menacing charges. In a statement sent Wednesday, schools Superintendent Dr. Wayne Loper said: "Earlier today, building administration at North High School was made aware that a student had come to school with what was determined to be a BB gun. Law enforcement was immediately notified and the BB gun was confiscated by school officials. The student's parents were also contacted. Nassau County police officers arrived at the school and interviewed the student. It is important to note that all students are safe, and based on both the district and police investigations of the incident, at no point were students at any risk of harm or danger. In compliance with student privacy regulations, no additional information can be shared at this time. The safety and well-being of our students is our top priority. We take situations like this very seriously and will take disciplinary action based on our Student Code of Conduct and to the full extent of the law against any student found bringing a weapon of any kind into our schools or onto school grounds. "

Summary: Student shot with pellet gun during baseball practice
Narrative: A student was reportedly injured by a pellet gun during an after-school baseball practice at South Jones High School, the Jones County School District said in a statement. According to JCSD, a student athlete was injured by a “ricochet or errant shot from a pellet gun” that was fired from a nearby residence during practice. The Ellisville Police Department said that the shot was fired by a juvenile and hit a juvenile victim. According to EPD, the injury sustained was in an extremity and was not life-threatening. The school district said that the pellet gun was not on school property and was never brought on school grounds and that the shot in question was from outside of the school’s baseball facility. Once the incident occurred, parents, law enforcement and other authorities were made aware.

Summary: Mother and daughter killed in drive-by shooting in front of the school, crashed into parking lot
Narrative: The two victims names’ were withheld, but on Wednesday, April 2, Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department Lt. DeJong identified the deceased as a 45-year-old woman and her 22-year-old daughter, per a press release. Deputies from Compton Sheriff’s Station were dispatched just after 7 p.m. EST Tuesday, April 1, to the intersection of Caldwell Street and Central Avenue, near Caldwell Street Elementary. Authorities arrived to find the two women dead, suffering from multiple gunshot wounds. Their Toyota sedan had crashed onto the sidewalk near a traffic pole. One woman’s body was discovered in the street, while the other body was still in the car. “Investigators learned the victims were in their vehicle on Caldwell Street, stopped at the signal light, when a vehicle pulled alongside,” the press release read. “Investigators believe an occupant in the other vehicle [opened] fire on the victims.” Shooter is believed to be the victim's former spouse.

Summary: Student found body of a man who commit suicide near the baseball field
Narrative: The Bexar County Medical Examiner said a body found on the campus of Jefferson High School Friday morning is that of a 66-year-old man. First responders were called to the school around 8 a.m., as some students were still arriving for class. The body was discovered east of the main building, near the baseball field.

School: Pete and Gracie Hosp Elementary School
Summary: Gunshot fired through the window of occupied classroom; woman accross the street was search house for intruder, she tripped, fell, and fired a shot that struck the school
Narrative: On Thursday, March 27, 2025, at approximately 9:28 a.m., a Frisco Police Officer assigned to the School Resource Officer Unit responded to a suspicious circumstance at Hosp Elementary, located at 5050 Lone Star Ranch Parkway. Upon arrival, the officer observed a classroom window had been shattered by an unknown object and fragments believed to belong to a bullet were later discovered. No injuries were reported, and out of an abundance of caution, students were dismissed early. Frisco Detectives responded to the school to look into the matter, and evidence at the scene was documented and collected by FPD’s Crime Scene Unit. Upon initial investigation, Detectives located the source of the bullet and believe the act was not intentional. There is no evidence to suggest that the school was targeted, nor is there a threat to the public, and students are safe to return to campus. The incident is still under investigation and upon completion, the matter will be referred to the Denton County District Attorney’s Office.

Summary: Armed man involved in domestic dispute shot an officer at the school administration building, neighboring school locked down
Narrative: A police officer and wanted subject are in the hospital after a shooting near the Kalamazoo Public Schools administration building. Officers were attempting to apprehend a “wanted subject” when the subject pulled out a gun, according to a statement from the Kalamazoo Township Police Department. Both the officer and the subject suffered gunshot wounds, police said. Officers responded to the scene in the 1200 block of Howard Street at roughly 11 a.m. on Thursday, March 27. Yellow crime scene tape was stretched near the entrance of the building in the parking lot. The nearby middle school, Maple Street Magnet School for the Arts, is on lockdown, according to parents. Kalamazoo Public Schools officials could not be immediately reached for comment. The situation started on the west side of Kalamazoo Township, near Kendall Street, according to the police chief. He said officers responded to an assault in which a suspect — described as a 23-year-old Portage man with a criminal history — assaulted his girlfriend and pointed a gun at her. The suspect has been out on parole since April 2024, Ergang said.

Summary: Three teens shot at another teen while students were on the playground for recess
Narrative: Three teens shot at another teen while students were on the playground for recess. Students were rushed inside the school to lockdown. All three teens fled. Four shell casings were recovered near the playground.

Summary: Girl shot at the school after dismissal
Narrative: An underage girl was hurt in a shooting Monday afternoon in the area of KIPP Memphis Academy High School in North Memphis, according to the Memphis Police Department. KIPP Memphis tells Action News 5 that the shooting happened after school hours and that no students were involved or injured. “We will continue to prioritize campus safety and will fully cooperate with the authorities should they need any support in their ongoing investigation,” said a school spokesperson. A young girl, whose exact age was not disclosed, was found at the scene with non-critical gunshot injuries. She was sent to Le Bonheur Children’s Hospital for treatment.

Summary: Bullet struck the school building causing 2 hour lockdown and early dismissal
Narrative: According to the Columbus Division of Police, shots were fired in the area of Chicago Avenue around 9:18 a.m. As a result, Franklinton Prep High School was on lockdown for a couple of hours. The building was struck, but no injuries were reported. Bullets went through the walls of the school office. The lockdown was lifted around 11:15 a.m. Students were released for the day once police determined the area was safe. The school said in a statement that they have no reason to believe the situation was related to the school and at no point were students or staff targeted.

Summary: Shots fired near the playground hit an occupied school bus at dismissal
Narrative: A school bus was hit by gunfire in the Bronx while carrying students with special needs on Friday afternoon. The shooting happened near East 163rd Street and Trinity Avenue in the Longwood section just before 2:20 p.m. The bus was struck at least three times. One bullet struck the back window, and two struck the side of the bus. Police say four suspects, all wearing black, were shooting at each other and the bus got caught in the crossfire. They say the shooting took place near a playground, with a school just down the block. Teachers say the shooting sent the school into lockdown, sheltering nervous students and staff in place for about 30 minutes past dismissal.

Summary: Police shot man with handgun who was threatening people behind the school
Narrative: Police in Denver shot and injured a man in an alley behind a school in the city's North Denver neighborhood on Thursday evening. Emergency calls made to authorities about the man before police responded indicated that he was armed with a gun and possibly was threatening people. Thomas said that when officers arrived the man was issued a number of directions by officers and the man refused to drop a weapon that appears to have been a semi-automatic handgun. That's when an officers -- fearing for their safety -- shot him. It's not clear so far how many rounds were fired. Thomas said he doesn't believe the man fired at the officers.

Summary: Two students and a former student fired shots during a fight on the baseball field
Narrative: Forsyth County Sheriff’s Office deputies have arrested two Carver High School students and a former Winston-Salem/Forsyth County Schools student on assault charges after shots were reportedly fired at CHS students last month. On March 19, two students reported they were fired at while on the school baseball field during school hours after an exchange of words with another group of students, according to a FCSO news release. No students were hurt. An investigation was launched that resulted in a teen and two juveniles being charged.

Summary: Shots fired outside the school, after school activities went on lockdown
Narrative: Police responded for a shooting in the parking lot outside the school. Students and staff on campus for after school activities when on lockdown. No injuries. Shooter fled.

Summary: 16-year-old fatally shot near the basketball court
Narrative: 16-year-old was fatally shot near the basketball court. Shooter fled before police arrived.

Summary: Man took woman's gun during domestic dispute, shot by police on the street in front of the school, school went on 4 hour lockdown
Narrative: At approximately 1:06 p.m., Richmond County Sheriff’s deputies responded to a call about a domestic dispute at a residence on Primrose Drive, according to a RCSO statement. Upon arrival, deputies spoke with a female complainant who reported that a man she knew had stolen her firearm and left the home prior to the deputies’ arrival. Minutes later, a deputy located the suspect near 2941 Glenn Hills Drive, in front of Glenn Hills Middle School, based on the description provided by the complainant. When the deputy attempted to make contact, the suspect allegedly pulled a firearm from his waistband, prompting the deputy to fire his weapon, the RCSO statement says. The suspect was struck and immediately transported to Doctors Hospital in critical condition. Principal Marvin Washington of Glenn Hills Middle School told parents about the shooting. He said they reacted by to the off-campus shooting by limiting class transitions and suspending outdoor movement. The school eventually resumed a normal schedule with additional support from RCSS Police for the remainder of the day.

Summary: Two teens committed armed robbery in school parking lot
Narrative: Authorities arrested an 18-year-old man and a teenager in connection with an armed robbery at a Moreno Valley High School earlier this week.  It happened at around 5:10 p.m. on Tuesday at Canyon Springs High School, located in the 23000 block of Cougar Canyon Drive, according to the Riverside County Sheriff's Department. Deputies arrived after receiving reports of an armed robbery involving two suspects at the school. Both were located and taken into custody. "The firearm used in the incident was located in a vehicle parked on campus," deputies said. They identified one of the suspects as 18-year-old Norah Arias of Moreno Valley. The second suspect was unidentified due to his age.

Summary: Shot fired during carjacking in school parking lot broke school window during classes
Narrative: The Adam’s County Sheriff’s Office said the armed carjacking occurred in the 7600 block of Navajo St. just after 1 p.m. The Sheriff’s Office said at least one shot was fired during the carjacking, and the bullet went through the window of a school. Deputies said the suspects crashed the stolen vehicle from the carjacking into a parked vehicle and then attempted to run away from the scene.
