They said several juveniles and one 18-year-old were detained. No injuries were reported from the school or the carjacking, but deputies said schools in the area went on lockdown.

Summary: Man shot during dispute between woman and another man in a car
Narrative: Adult man was talking to a woman in the parking lot when she became involved in a dispute with another man on the phone. A car pulled up and fired shot striking the man in the neck. Police found the victim was found in the area in front of the school around 5 a.m. The victim flagged a police officer down in front of the elementary school entrance saying he had been shot in the neck.

Summary: Woman pointed gun at her husband during argument at varsity baseball game
Narrative: The Hondo Police Department arrested a woman for allegedly pointing a gun at her ex-husband during a child custody dispute at a varsity softball game. On March 7, HPD responded to a varsity softball game between Hondo High School and Comfort High School after receiving reports of a disturbance involving a weapon outside the left outfield fence of the stadium. Authorities said the dispute involve four individuals regarding child custody. During the argument, police said 30-year-old Elysia Quinn Klatt grabbed a firearm from a vehicle and allegedly pointed it at her ex-husband before being immediately disarmed by another male involved in the altercation. No shots were fired.

Summary: 13-year-old student threatened 10 classmates with a gun, school went on lockdown, student arrested
Narrative: A minor was arrested Friday morning after allegedly bringing a handgun to Bookcliff Middle School and making threatening statements to students. The incident occurred around 9:05 a.m. when the Grand Junction Police Department and District 51 Safety and Security responded to reports of felony menacing. Officers quickly found the handgun and took the 13-year-old into custody. The teen was transported to the Division of Youth Services on 10 counts of felony menacing, Weapon possession at school/childcare – firearm, Possession of a handgun by a juvenile, Interference with staff, faculty or students of educational institutions. There were no injuries in this incident. The handgun was not discharged, the police department said.

Summary: Teacher committed suicide inside a school classroom
Narrative: A Teacher was found dead at Munford High School Thursday morning, leading to the school’s closure for the day, according to Tipton County Schools. The Munford Police Department later identified the teacher as Samuel Colin Day, the special education director. He was found dead in one of the classrooms from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound. Assistant Superintendent Dr. Rebekah Byrd said in a statement that the staff member was found dead during the early morning hours before students were present. The situation was referred to as an “isolated incident.” Munford High School will remain closed for the day while Munford Police continue their investigation.

School: Martin Luther King Jr. Middle School
Summary: Two people shot on access road connecting apartments and school bus lot
Narrative: In a statement CMPD confirmed the shooting incident occurred in the North Tryon Division just before 3 p.m. on Northchase Drive. Northchase Dr leads directly to the bus lot of Martin Luther King Jr. Middle School. Through emails with Charlotte Mecklenburg Schools, WCCB confirmed that Martin Luther King Jr. Middle and Hidden Valley Elementary Schools were both placed on lockdown for more than 30 minutes. A district spokesperson said that parents were made aware of the lockdown, and that it did delay dismissal until law enforcement gave the all clear.

Summary: Student shot across the street from campus, fled onto campus, shooter chased him and fired multiple shots killing him
Narrative: Shortly after 2:30 p.m. Tuesday, police received reports of a shooting in the 3900 block of Hollins Ferry Road, near Lansdowne High School, according to Baltimore County Police Chief Robert McCullough. After the 16-year-old student victim was shot and fell to the ground, the suspect walked up to the victim and shot them. The wounded victim fled onto the Lansdowne High School campus where the shooter chased him and fired multiple shots killing the student. The suspect got back into a car and fled.

Summary: Student shot at the bus stop in front of the school, school went on lockdown for 90 minutes
Narrative: Officers were alerted at 2:22 p.m. Tuesday to a shooting or a stabbing near a bus stop in the 10700 block of S. First Street, the release said. Police found the victim at the scene and located the person they arrested nearby, the release said. Akins High School is located at 10701 S. First St. The school's principal, Michael Herbin, sent a letter to parents about the incident. "While today’s incident took a significant emotional toll on our school community, our campus is safe," the letter said. "Out of an abundance of caution, we will have increased police presence on campus tomorrow." The campus was placed on hold shortly after 2:30 p.m. Tuesday, which meant that students and staff were kept in their classrooms and hallways were kept clear, according to the letter. It said no one was allowed to enter or leave the school. The hold was lifted at 4:01 p.m. Tuesday, the letter said.

Summary: Female student shot while walking to school along the fence by the parking lot
Narrative: Police said, around 7:40 a.m., a 15-year-old girl was walking near 85th Street and Lafayette Avenue, when a black sedan pulled up, and two gunmen got out and started shooting. The shooting happened along the fence at the athletic field of Perspectives Leadership Academy, where the girl is a student. The girl was shot in the thigh, and was taken to Comer Children's Hospital in fair condition. The shooters got back into the sedan and fled the scene. At least six shell casings and evidence markers were found on the scene.

Summary: Two adults shots in the school parking lot
Narrative: At 3:57 p.m., officers were called to the school for a report of a gunshot that had been heard. When police arrived at the scene, they found a 23-year-old woman and a 25-year-old man in the parking lot with gunshot wounds.

Summary: Group of teens fired shots outside the school and fled before police arrived
Narrative: South Elgin police first responded to calls of an armed group near Fox Meadow Elementary School at about 5:44 p.m. As police were enroute, more calls came in reporting that shots had been fired, and the group had run away. The shooting happened outside of school hours, police said there were no reports of staff or students in the building at this time.

Summary: Masked gunman ambushed student when he got off the school bus
Narrative: Police say a Capital School District bus was dropping off a group of students from Dover High School on Village Drive.  The victim-a 16-year-old– was one of those students getting off the bus when an unknown individual wearing a mask began chasing him.  Soon after, the suspect began shooting at the victim as they both were running.  The bus driver followed predetermined safety protocols and immediately left the area, ensuring the safety of the children who remained on the bus.  No one was injured as a result of this shooting.

Summary: Man fired 15 shots in the field next to the school at dismissal
Narrative: Sierra Vista Police swiftly arrested a man on Feb. 18 for unlawfully discharging a firearm after responding to a call near Joyce Clark Middle School. A witness reported more than 15 shots fired as students were being released, causing a tense situation. Officers found an adult male with a handgun and took him into custody. The man told officers he recently bought the handgun and wanted to target shoot. He claimed a local gun store advised him to go into the desert. Sierra Vista Police charged the man with unlawful discharge of a firearm within city limits and booked him into Cochise County Jail.

Summary: Student pointed a gun at six other students in the parking lot
Narrative: A 17-year-old student riding in a vehicle pointed a gun at six other students in the school parking lot. The sheriff said the teenager was caught with a rifle and handgun. He said the teenager faces six charges, including three counts of pointing a gun at another, two counts of having a firearm in a school safety zone and one count of being a minor illegally in possession of a firearm – the pistol.

Summary: Teen fired multiple shots with a shotgun during a fight in the parking lot, 2 teens killed
Narrative: Oklahoma City Police are investigating a double homicide that happened at a local elementary school Tuesday night at 8:30pm. “A dispute occurred, a gun battle ultimately ensued following that dispute,” said Sgt. Dillon Quirk with the Oklahoma City Police Department. Officers responded to a local hospital after several people came in with gunshot wounds. Police said 18-year-old Oscar Herrera died at the hospital. Then, a few hours later, a 17-year-old boy died. Authorities say a group gathered on the lot of Coolidge Elementary near South Villa. The number of people in the group is unknown.

Summary: Five teens fired 47 shots in the woods behind the school causing a lockdown
Narrative: The Metro Nashville Police Department has announced the arrest of five teenage boys after shots were fired near Cane Ridge High School on Tuesday. MNPD reports that the five teens (three age 15 and two age 16) were arrested on Thursday at a gas station on Old Hickory Boulevard near Bell Road during a traffic stop. During the stop, police said two guns were recovered from the truck. On Tuesday, officers responded to a shots fired call near the high school where a reported truck was involved in the incident. The school was placed on a brief lockdown due to the report. MNPD said that 47 shell casings were recovered in the area of Sprucedale Drive. Officers investigating the matter on Wednesday were able to retrieve more information on the truck based on a nearby neighborhood’s license plate reader cameras. On Thursday, officers found the truck while patrolling the area of Sprucedale Drive, followed it for a short time and conducted a traffic stop. All five teens, none of whom attend CRHS, exited the truck and were arrested. A nine-millimeter and .40 caliber pistol were recovered from the truck.

Summary: Three windows in cafeteria broken by shots fired during drive-by, school went on lockdown
Narrative: Three windows of the cafeteria were broken when 12 shots were fired during a shooting involving two vehicles at the gas station across from the school. Students were on campus and the school went on lockdown.

Summary: Shot fired in the field outside the school
Narrative: Woodlawn High School sheltered in place for a time Friday afternoon as police investigated a call for shots fired nearby. Police said officers determined that someone fired a gun into the air near a field surrounding school property. Police said this was not a targeted incident. As officers searched the area, a shelter-in-place order was briefly activated at the school out of an abundance of caution.

Summary: Two people where shot in a car that drove to the front of the school, school went on lockdown, victim flown from the campus
Narrative: Two people who were shot while driving near the campus drove to the front of the school for help. The vehicle stopped in the traffic circle near the front doors of the school. 15 shots were fired. One of the victims died. The other was flown from the school in critical condition. The school went on lockdown while police responded.

Summary: GUn fired inside 2nd grader's backpack, bullet deflected off another student's laptop
Narrative: A firearm accidentally discharged inside a student’s backpack at Challenger Elementary School on Thursday afternoon, according to school officials. Officials with Huntsville City Schools said the incident happened during dismissal around 2:45 p.m. inside a 2nd-grade child’s backpack as students were in the hallway preparing to leave school. School officials said a bullet hit another student’s backpack, damaging the student’s laptop. The student whose backpack was hit reportedly experienced ringing in the ears due to the proximity of the bullet, according to school officials.

Summary: SRO called police for two aggressive dogs on the playground, officers shot one of the dogs
Narrative: On Thursday, Feb. 6, 2025, a school resource officer at Menominee Elementary School, located in the Upper Peninsula, contacted police about two pit bulls that were barking aggressively at children at the playground. The officers tried to stop the dogs with a dog pole and Tasers but failed. “As the situation escalated, officers observed the dogs running back toward the school playground,” said the Menominee Police Department. “To prevent an immediate threat to the children, officers struck the dogs with a patrol vehicle and subsequently had to fatally shoot one of them.”

Summary: Teen shot in front of elementary school, ran into high school for help
Narrative: A 17-year-old was shot in front of the elementary school during morning classes. The shooter fled and the victim ran inside the nearby high school for assistance. The schools did not go on lockdown and parents were not notified.

Summary: Elderly man fired two shots during school event, tackled by bystanders
Narrative: A man was driving with his wife when he pulled over, said he needed to use the bathroom, and went into the school. Pasadena police say an 83-year-old man armed with a gun entered the school through a backdoor around 6 p.m. while the Texas Color Guard Circuit drum line competition was taking place. Police say he hid behind a pillar for about two minutes before emerging and firing at least one shot. A young adult man was hit in the shoulder, and Life Flighted to the hospital. Within a minute of the shooting, police say a parent tackled the shooter. One parent tells Eyewitness News he and three others restrained the suspect and confiscated his weapon. The competition was canceled, and no students were injured. The man had no connect to the school or event. Before arriving at the school, police said they were told by the man that he was being chased by someone and feared he and his wife were going to be killed. The man then left his home in Spring, TX and ended up in Pasadena, where he stopped at the school. The shooting victim, a percussion technical consultant for Angleton ISD. Police said he does not know the shooting victim and was never in contact with him. The Harris County District Attorney's Office has accepted charges of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon. Brandl is being held without bond and is awaiting transfer to the Harris County Jail. He is a retired Navy veteran with no prior criminal history.

Summary: Adult man and teen shot in front of the school during dismissal
Narrative: An 18-year-old man and a 26-year-old man were outside on the sidewalk in front of the school at dismissal when a gunman opened fire. The 18-year-old was struck multiple times in the body and pronounced dead at the scene. The 26-year-old was struck in the chest and taken to Mt. Sinai Hospital in fair condition. The shooter fled.

Summary: Man fired shot near school causing lockdown and then fired shots are police officers
Narrative: A suspect was arrested and is facing multiple felony charges after reported shots fired near Madisonville Primary School, according to the Madisonville Police Department. Madisonville Primary was placed on a soft lockdown Thursday morning as MPD officers investigated. As the situation escalated with shots fired near an occupied patrol vehicle, MPD's special response team was called in and a hard lockdown was implemented for the school, according to police. Madisonville officers later found and arrested the shooter on McConkey Street. They said the suspect was under the influence and on active probation for drug offenses.

Summary: Teen fired shots at a student during an altercation
Narrative: Kent Police are looking for a 17-year-old boy who reportedly fired a gun at another teen in the Kentridge High School parking lot Monday evening, Jan. 27 while fans were inside the school gym watching an unified basketball game. Officers were dispatched at about 7:40 p.m. to the school, 12430 SE 208th St., after a 911 call about a gun being fired outside the school and people running in the parking lot, according to a Jan. 28 Kent Police news release. Multiple officers arrived at the school and attempted to locate witnesses to the incident, but after speaking with several people in the area, no one admitted to seeing or hearing anything of concern, according to police. The video reportedly showed two teens talking to each other, a physical altercation between the two and one of them pulling out a gun and shooting it at the other one, according to police. Nobody was injured. Both fled the scene. School security identified both teens from the video, including the shooter as a 17-year-old male and former Kentridge student, according to police. The person he shot at is a current Kentridge student.

Summary: Person shot in the school parking lot
Narrative: Person shot in the school parking lot after students dismissed.

School: Academy for College and Career Exploration
Summary: Shots fired near school bus at dismissal
Narrative: City Schools officials told 11 News that shots were fired around 3 p.m. across the street from the Academy for College and Career Exploration on West 36th Street. City police told 11 News that officers are investigating reports of shots fired near the location. Students were on board a Maryland Transit Administration bus and a school bus, waiting to leave. No students aboard the buses were injured, but their departures were delayed so that everyone could be evaluated as a precaution. Police said no injuries have been reported. Baltimore City and City Schools police continue to investigate.

Summary: Man shot in the school parking lot
Narrative: Officers were called around 4:40 a.m. Thursday to the 1200 block of 49th Street NE, which is the block where Ron Brown High School and the school’s parking lot are located. On the scene, they found a man who had been shot in the lower extremities.

Summary: Student shot two classmates and then shot himself inside the cafeteria
Narrative: A 17-year-old male student fatally shot a female student and then fatally shot himself with a handgun at 11:09 AM inside the cafeteria. Cellphone video recorded the sounds of at least 3 gunshots. The teen fired multiple shots at the female student who died and then fired one shot killing himself. A male student was grazed, and a second male student suffered a non-gunshot injury that required hospitalization. While it appears that he deliberately targeted one female student who was killed, what is believed to be his social media account posted violent, racist, and antisemitic content. The writings include detailed plans for the shooting and reasons behind committing the attack, along with mentions of other school shootings. The shooting was livestreamed on KICK, a platform known for the lack of content moderation and hate speech. The 17-year-old student who opened fire in the cafeteria at least 10 shots from a nine-millimeter pistol within 17 seconds. A pistol magazine loaded with seven rounds was reportedly recovered from the cafeteria floor. The sources confirm that Henderson got into trouble after bringing a box cutter to school. Those sources confirm he was also suspended after getting into a fight when he said he was insulted by a student, and that in middle school, he was disciplined after threatening a teacher’s life. MNPD also confirmed that two documents – one 51 pages in length, another 288 pages – are believed to have been written by Henderson. Police said those documents show that Henderson was “significantly influenced by web-based material, especially that were found on non-traditional sites that most would find harmful and objectionable.” WSMV4 Investigates has reviewed the documents, in which Henderson writes of his praise for other school shooters, detailed instructions on how to make a bomb, and his plans for launching a school shooting while live streaming it.

Summary: Family member of student shot in vehicle near the school, police responded to school parking lot
Narrative: See the full statement released by JMCSS officials: Dear JMCSS Families, We want to inform you about an off-campus incident that has led to the cancellation of all after-school activities scheduled for today at Northeast Middle School. Local law enforcement is currently investigating a shooting that occurred near I-40 and Christmasville Road. A vehicle involved in the incident, which included a family from our district, pulled into the Northeast Middle School parking lot. Emergency responders provided care to an individual from the vehicle at the scene, and the Madison County Sheriff’s Office is gathering additional information at this time. While there is no ongoing threat to students or staff, out of an abundance of caution, we have canceled all after-school events at the school for the safety and well-being of everyone involved.

Summary: Parent accidentally shot self in the school parking lot before dismissal
Narrative: According to officials, officers responded to the 300 block of Woodland Road around 2:10 p.m. in reference to a self-inflicted shooting in the rear parking lot of John Smith Elementary School. Upon arrival, officers found a man in a vehicle outside of the school with a gunshot wound that was not life-threatening. Members of the Hampton Division of Fire and Rescue responded and took the man to a local hospital. Hampton Police said the man was charged with possession of a firearm on school property, discharge of a firearm within 1000 feet of a school and reckless handling of a firearm. There was no threat to the school and no students and staff were in danger.

Summary: Grandmother fired shot during fight between students
Narrative: A grandmother fired a gun at a community center that is connected to a Memphis Shelby County School on Wednesday after one of the kids her grandson was fighting threatened to flip her car over, police say. It all started when Memphis Police responded to a complaint call at Mitchell Community Center which is connected to Mitchell High School on 602 West Mitchell Road. Administrators at the scene told officers they saw Joyce Brown fire a shot into the ground when a fight between her grandson and another child got out of control. They say the parking lot was full of children who ran after the shooting.

Summary: Student intentionally shot herself inside a school bathroom
Narrative: “This afternoon, a student at Lindley Middle School tragically used a firearm to commit self-harm, prompting a code red,” the Cobb County School District said in a statement. “School administrators, along with a Cobb County School District police officer, responded immediately and secured the weapon.” The Mableton school was placed on lockdown, but authorities quickly organized for parents to pick up their students at Leland Memorial United Methodist Church, located just across Veterans Memorial Highway. By 5:30 p.m., all of the school’s students had been picked up by parents or sent home by bus.

Summary: Former student fired shots during a large fight at dismissal
Narrative: An 18-year-old former student was on campus at dismissal, fired shots during a large fight, and then fled from campus police while holding a loaded handgun. He was arrested 2 blocks away from the school.

Summary: Teen pointed replica AR-15 at students on the playground, intened suicide by cop
Narrative: A 17-year-old suspect is facing 112 counts after they were walking near the playground of Verplanck Elementary School with an airsoft rifle on Monday in Manchester, according to police. The school was placed under lockdown out of precaution. Witnesses reported that the individual was pointing the rifle at the school, into classroom windows and at students and staff. During the investigation, it was determined that the suspect pointed the weapon at 29 children and 10 adults on the school grounds. The suspect, a 17-year-old from Manchester, said that he was intended to commit “suicide by cop.” He was charged with multiple offenses.

Summary: Student brandished a gun and threatened another student during lunch in the bathroom
Narrative: Around 1:30 p.m. on Jan. 9, The Springville Police Department (SPD) became aware of incident that occurred at Springville High School that involved a student threatening another. According to SPD, a teacher had noticed one of her students “was visibly distressed in her class.” Upon further investigation, the student revealed they had allegedly been threatened with a firearm by another student. Heavy law enforcement was dispatched to investigate, and a search for the suspect began. The event allegedly occurred prior to the school’s lunch hour in one of the bathrooms. Police reported that they gained the suspects identity, and determined that the juvenile suspect left the school after the incident. The suspect was later located and arrested by police. The Juvenile has been booked into the Juvenile Detention Center on charges of aggravated assault, brandishing a weapon, and bring a dangerous weapon onto school property.

Summary: Two teens shot during planned fight between two groups of teens
Narrative: Two teenage boys were injured in a shooting Tuesday evening in Southeast Portland. Both have been hospitalized but are expected to survive, according to Portland Police Bureau Public Information Manager Mike Benner. The shooting happened at around 8:30 p.m. in the area around Mill Park Elementary School and Mill City Park, according to police scanner traffic. Benner said it was initially reported as a disturbance near a school, but officers arrived and found the two victims. No suspects have been located, Benner said, adding that the early investigation suggests that the shooting broke out after two groups "met to settle an issue."

School: Dr. Susan S. McKinney Secondary School of the Arts
Summary: Student shot outside of the school, ran into the school for assistance
Narrative: A 17-year-old boy was shot near Dr. Susan S. McKinney Secondary School of the Arts in Fort Greene on Thursday morning, police said. The shooting happened just before 8:30 a.m. at the corner of Park Avenue and North Oxford Street. Police say the teen was struck in the stomach and managed to run to the school, where he got help from school safety agents. He was taken to Methodist Hospital and is in stable condition, according to authorities.

Summary: Person shot in the chest outside the school
Narrative: The city's emergency communications center received a call reporting shots fired at the high school around 7:05 p.m. "The victim was transported to the hospital with a chest wound."

Summary: Two men shot next to the school
Narrative: Two adult men were shot next to the school building. Shooter fled.

Summary: Teen fired 11 shots at a group of students on the front steps hitting windows and the building
Narrative: Just after 8 a.m. Tuesday, police responded to calls about shots being fired, and that was quickly updated to an 11-round ShotSpotter alert in front of Perry High School, according to the criminal complaint. Officers found 11 bullet casings and a laser attachment for a gun near the front stairs outside the high school. Officers additionally observed that the exterior of the building was struck by bullets multiple times, along with windows above the front door, the complaint said. Police said there were several hundred students and dozens of staff members inside the building at the time. Perry operated in secure status Tuesday, keeping students inside and continuing normal activities as much as possible, according to Ebony Pugh, spokeswoman for Pittsburgh Public Schools. She said support resources would be available for students and staff who may need assistance. The school provided detectives with security footage, which showed a juvenile wearing a black hood and mask, gray sweatpants, and bright blue and white sneakers. The person was seen shooting at about eight students on the steps, the complaint said.

Summary: Female student shot at dismissal, ran back inside school for help
Narrative: A 17-year-old female student was shot on the street outside the school at dismissal during an attempted robbery by two men in a vehicle. A teenage male shooter fled from the area and turned himself in 3 days later. The victim ran back into the school for assistance.

Summary: Student injured by broken glass when school bus window was shot
Narrative: According to Charlotte-Mecklenburg Police, the incident occurred around 4 p.m. on Idlewild Road North near the Albemarle Road Recreation Center. When officers arrived, they discovered an Infiniti vehicle and Charlotte-Mecklenburg Schools bus had each been shot into. Officers made an arrest from the incident, described by CMS officials as “a dispute outside the bus.” but a suspect’s name has not been released. The shooting remains under investigation.

Summary: Student opened fire inside the school and then commit suicide
Narrative: Student opened fire inside a classroom during study period and then commit suicide before police arrived. Armed with two handguns, only one was fired during the attack. A search of Natalie’s room netted a six-page document the girl had written entitled “War Against Humanity.” She started the piece by describing humanity as “filth” and saying she hated people who don’t care and “smoke their lungs out with weed or drink as much as they can like my own father.” She wrote about how she admired school shooters, how her mother was not in her life and how she obtained her weapons “by lies and manipulation, and my fathers stupidity.” Investigators also discovered maps of the school and a cardboard model of the building, along with a handwritten schedule that detailed how she would being the attack at 11:30 a.m. and wipe out the first and second floors of the school by 11:55 a.m. She planned to end the attack by 12:10 p.m. with a notation “ready 4 Death.” She had been communicating online with people around the world about her fascination with school shootings and weapons. effrey Rupnow told investigators that his daughter lived with him but had been struggling with his divorce from her mother in 2022, saying she hated her life and wanted to kill herself. He said she used to cut herself to the point where he had to lock up all the knives in his house. She had been in therapy to learn how to be more social until the spring before the attack, he told investigators. Her mother, Melissa Rupnow, told detectives that the therapist told her that Natalie was suffering post-traumatic stress disorder stemming from the divorce. One of Natalie’s friends told investigators that Jeffrey Rupnow was “frequently verbally aggressive” with Natalie and that she had told him that her father was a “drinker,” according to the complaint. Jeffery Rupnow told investigators that took Natalie shooting with him on a friend’s land about two years before the Abundant Life attack. She enjoyed it, and he came to see guns as a way to connect with her. But he was shocked at how her interest in firearms “snow balled,” he told investigators. He kept Natalie’s pistols in a gun safe, telling her that if she ever need them the access code was his Social Security number entered backward. About 10 days before the school attack, he texted a friend and said that Natalie would shoot him if he left “the fun safe open right now,” according to the complaint.

Summary: Shots fired during fight after high school basketball game
Narrative: The incident occurred after the Brainerd and Howard High School rivalry game. Harrington recounted hearing “back-to-back” shots that were “loud” and caused panic in the parking lot. “Soon as the shots went off, everybody was just in panic mode. Took off, and in that moment I wasn't concerned about myself, I was just trying to get my wife and brothers in the car,” Harrington added. Administrators with Hamilton County Schools (HCS) say they are working with police to get to the bottom of an incident involving gunfire in the parking lot.

Summary: Security guard accidentally fired gun inside break room
Narrative: A security guard at an elementary school in Indiana County is under investigation after police said he accidentally discharged his firearm, shooting a refrigerator in the faculty room on Friday morning. Pennsylvania State Police said troopers were called to Purchase Line Elementary School in Green Township around 9:15 a.m. to investigate after an on-duty school security guard accidentally fired his gun. Troopers said they learned that the security guard was handling his gun in the faculty room shortly after 9 a.m. when the firearm fired one round, hitting a refrigerator. Police said there were no injuries and the incident didn't result in any disruption to student activities. The school day will carry on as normal and dismissal will remain unchanged, police said.

Summary: SRO's gun was fired on the school playground while he was passing out stickers to kids
Narrative: The MCSO says the deputy was handing out stickers to several students while sitting on a wooden bench prior to the incident. While helping one of the kids zip up their jacket, the deputy heard his gun go off. The child who was on the deputy’s gun side reportedly told the deputy and a teacher that he made the gun “shoot.” Detectives conducted a series of tests to recreate the incident and also inspected the deputy’s service pistol. During the investigation, they found that there was a “significant gap” between the gun’s trigger guard and the trigger guard of the holster that allowed the trigger to be easily manipulated while inside the holster.

Summary: Shots fired when SRO attempted to break up a fight
Narrative: An individual told a School Resource Officer (SRO) at East Magnet Middle about a fight happening between a group of men at the business that borders the campus parking lot. The officer attempted to break up the fight when a man fired a shot into the air and ran off, wearing only one shoe. The school went on lockdown while police searched for the shooter who escaped.

Summary: Security guard accidentally shot himself in the leg
Narrative: The victim was working as an overnight security guard at Farrington High School when he said he heard a loud bang. The victim then saw that he had been shot in the thigh. The victim’s brother was also present at the time. Sources say police are now looking into the possibility the shooting was an accident whether the security guard or his brother accidentally fired the gun. Farrington High School sent out a letter to parents this afternoon saying that the school will reopen on normal schedules tomorrow, Dec. 12. The school wants to assure that no students or staff were involved and that there is no active threat to the campus.

Summary: District constable accidentally fired gun inside a school office
Narrative: The Milford School District has released a statement regarding the accidental discharge of a firearm in a private staff workroom by a district constable. The statement is as follows: “We regret to inform you there was an accidental discharge of a firearm in a private staff workroom this afternoon by a district constable. While there were no injuries and no threat to the safety or security of our school, staff, or students, we are deeply concerned by this event. This incident did not impact our instructional areas with access to staff and students; however, we feel a responsibility to be transparent with our school community. While we understand this is concerning, please be assured that our constable staff receive thorough on-going certification and training regularly. We are working closely with our law enforcement partners to investigate this isolated incident thoroughly and to ensure all necessary safety measures are in place and followed with fidelity. This is an ongoing personnel investigation and no additional details are able to be shared at this time. Thank you for your understanding and support.”

Summary: Police officer fatally shot himself while getting equipment ready for training session
Narrative: SAPD officer who died by suicide was under investigation for invasive visual recording in Rockport, records show. SAPD said officer's death was not accidental, ruled a suicide. An SAPD officer was shot by his own pistol Tuesday morning in what police are calling a tragic accident. The shooting happened around 9:30 a.m. in the 1600 block of Fitch Street near West Southcross Boulevard at the Columbia Heights Elementary School building. SAPD Chief William McManus, who gave remarks at the scene, said Officer William Kasberg was arriving for state-mandated training at the school. He was reportedly gathering his belongings to take inside when his pistol went off accidentally.

Summary: Student shot in the parking lot during fight at dismissal
Narrative: An RJ Reynolds High School student was shot Tuesday afternoon on school grounds near the parking lot. The school was placed on lockdown and students were later reunited with their parents at Harris Teeter on Cloverdale Avenue. Forsyth County Sheriff Bobby Kimbrough Jr. said the shooting stemmed from an altercation that had taken place and that the victim was a student. He said the student was shot in the upper leg and is currently in the hospital recovering. Two adults and three students were arrested on Jan 14, 2025 in connection with the shooting.

Summary: Two teens fired a gun from a vehicle at a deer near the school
Narrative: Police said they were dispatched to assist school security with a hunter who discharged a firearm at a deer. After they arrived they were told by security there was a vehicle circling the building, and that security saw a gun was fired about 75 yards away from the building. Security followed the vehicle and was able to stop it. Police then shortly arrived and saw Valenzuela, who was the driver, and Abeleda standing outside the vehicle. According to the complaint, a Kel-Tec Sub-2000 folding pistol carbine was found on the front passenger floorboard, and a magazine with four 9mm rounds in it. More ammo was found behind the driver’s seat in a rifle case. The duo faces a felony charge of firearms not to be carried without a license, along with misdemeanor charges of possession of a weapon on school property, recklessly endangering another person and trespassing. They also face summary charges of hunting violations.

Summary: Two officers shot an adult man armed with two weapons outside a high school wrestling meet
Narrative: “On Thursday evening, at about 7:44 (p.m.), law enforcement received a call for service at the school parking lot at Yankton,” Jackley said. “When law enforcement arrived, ultimately they had an opportunity to begin a discussion with Mr. Jondahl. That discussion escalated, and ultimately there was a use of force by law enforcement.” Jackley confirmed Jondahl was at the school for the wrestling event. KELOLAND News spoke with Watertown superintendent Jeff Danielsen, who said that at the time of the shooting, all Watertown staff and athletes were already on their bus and headed home. He confirmed that Jondahl was not a member of faculty or directly involved in the team. Rather, he appeared to be a Watertown community member who had decided to attend the tournament. Jackley gave limited information on the reason that police were called, stating that a member of the public called about “a dangerous situation at the school.” “Unfortunately, it escalated after some conversations and discussions. At which point law enforcement acted,” Jackley said.

Summary: School went on lockdown for report of shots fired, two student arrested with paintball gun
Narrative: Police arrested two Carson High School students Thursday after they reportedly shot a paintball gun in the school parking lot. According to the Carson City Sheriff's Office, the incident started when dispatch got a call about someone with a weapon outside the high school around 9:35 a.m. The campus was put into a 'secure' status as school police, Carson City Sheriff's Office deputies and other law enforcement responded. Police arrested two students for possession of a dangerous weapon on school grounds and booked them into jail. According to CCSO, another student saw the students fire a gun but was unsure what type of weapon it was when reporting it to authorities.

Summary: Teen shot outside school during varsity basketball game
Narrative: The NYPD says a 17-year-old male teen was shot outside of Clara Barton High School on Wednesday night. Police say it happened on the corner of President Street and Washington Avenue at 6:39 p.m. Parents in the area told News 12 off camera a basketball game was being held right next door at Prospect Heights High School at around 5:30 p.m. They saw an hour later, their children heard multiple shots ring out, and the school went on lockdown. The teen was taken to Kings County Hospital and is now in stable condition.

Summary: Shots fired at a group of students by a student in a vehicle
Narrative: According to police, the shooter was driving a white, two-door pickup truck and confronted a group of five or six students in a car. He got out of his truck and began shooting at them. The students escaped uninjured, and the suspect fled the scene. A short time later, however, the same man fired two more shots at another car carrying teenagers nearby. No injuries were reported in that shooting either. Police believe the shooter is a student at the school knew both groups of teens. Vehicle with multiple bullet holes was found in the school parking lot.

Summary: Man shot two students and then killed himself
Narrative: An adult man shot two students and then killed himself at Feather River School of Seventh-Day Adventists in Palermo, a town of about 5,700 people south of Oroville, CA. Investigators believe the gunman targeted the Feather River School of Seventh-Day Adventists in Palermo, CA because of its affiliation with the church and he was motivated as a response to the war in Gaza. A note was found detailing the gunman's motive. The note said he sought to carry out the "child executions" as a "response to America's involvement with Genocide and Oppression of Palestinians along with the attacks towards Yemen". Authorities said the gunman had a lengthy mental health and criminal history, which included charges of theft, fraud, and forgery over the years. Butte County Sheriff said the 56-year-old gunman had scheduled a meeting with a school administrator to discuss enrolling a student. The meeting was seemingly cordial and he went on a tour, but things took a turn when the gunman walked towards a bathroom and started opening fire. The gunfire hit students outside a classroom, striking two kindergarten-aged children. The gunman then turned the handgun on himself, police said. He was found dead by first responders with the firearm near his body. The shooter attended a Seventh-day Adventist School in Paradise, California, many years ago and had a relative who attended the targeted school many years ago, investigators said. However, investigators said there is no current connection between the school and the suspect.

Summary: Community member commit suicide on football field
Narrative: At 7:19 p.m., the community member was located by an Ellis Police Officer, deceased from an apparent self-inflicted gunshot wound at the Ellis High School football field in the 400 block of West 10th Street in Ellis. No foul play is suspected at this time, and there is no threat to community safety.

Summary: Man shot deer in school parking lot
Narrative: Idaho Fish and Game is looking for information regarding the shooting of a white-tailed deer in the parking lot of the Orofino Elementary at 1000 Michigan Ave, Orofino, ID during the evening hours of November 26th, 2024.

Summary: Man fatally shot in front of school following dispute
Narrative: 20-year-old man was fatally shot in driveway in front of the school. Staff were inside the building. No students were present when the shooting occurred. Shooter fled.

Summary: Person killed outside elementary school
Narrative: A person was fatally shot beside the school building.

Summary: Person shot outside school during Thanksgiving break
Narrative: Mesquite police are investigating a shooting near Pirrung Elementary School. Police confirmed it happened on Monday afternoon outside the school building. Mesquite ISD is closed for the week because of Thanksgiving, so there were no children on campus at the time. SKY 4 captured images of police vehicles and crime scene tape blocking the entrances to the school’s parking lots.

Summary: Student accidentally shot himself in the leg in the school hallway
Narrative: The student initially told police someone else had shot him in a school courtyard, but authorities said based on video surveillance, witness interviews and other evidence, they believed the student accidentally shot himself while handling the gun in a hallway leading to the gym. No one else was injured. No gun has been recovered. Police suspect it may have been taken off campus by someone the student knew before officers got to the school and began searching while the campus was on lockdown.

Summary: Student killed and school bus stuck during shooting at dismissal
Narrative: Officer Christian Bruckhart, a spokesperson for the New Haven Police Department, said officers responded to a ShotSpotter alert at approximately 2:37 p.m. and found the teenager wounded, he said. The teenager was at first listed in critical condition, but he later succumbed to his injuries at the Yale-New Haven Hospital. Shortly after the shooting, officers stopped a vehicle carrying a group of boys, one of whom had a ghost gun — a homemade firearm — with an extended magazine, Jacobson said. Police arrested the boy, but do not believe he was the person who fired the shots that injured the 16-year-old. The shooter near Goffe and Hudson streets also hit a school bus carrying children from Celentano Biotech, Health and Medical Magnet School that was driving through the area. No one riding the bus was injured.

Summary: Teen shot outside school, ran inside for help
Narrative: A teen was shot outside the school during morning classes. After he was shot, he ran to nearby Eastern High School and went inside, DC Police said. The school went on lockdown. Three teen suspects fled.

Summary: Teen fired flare gun at soccer field during high school game
Narrative: A fiery shot from a flare gun nearly hit players in the middle of a soccer match, and Bradenton police say a 16-year-old admitted to firing the shot. According to investigators, the teen and his friends had just been kicked out of the match on the campus of a private school on Nov. 21 for "disruptive behavior." The teen fired the flare gun from the passenger seat of a vehicle, police said. Video released by the police department shows the flare narrowly missing players. The flare burned two holes in the field's artificial turf, causing more than $1,000 in damage, police said. The suspect, who is not a student at the private school, faces a felony criminal mischief charge, along with one count of misdemeanor culpable negligence.
Accomplice_Narrative: Multiple teens kicked out of game

Summary: Multiple shots hit bus taking students home from school
Narrative: Multiple shots fired from a vehicle struck a school bus taking students home. No students were injured.

Summary: Student threatened during class and then shot in the parking lot at dismissal
Narrative: A student was threatened by a classmate during class and then shot in the school parking lot at dismissal. Shooter fled before police arrived. Gun used was owned by the 16-year-old shooter's grandmother.

Summary: Student wounded when 50 shots were fired in the parking lot during a fight at a basketball game
Narrative: 50 shots were fired during a fight in the parking lot of Woodlawn High School in Birmingham, AL at the end of a varsity basketball game last night last night. One 17-year-old student was wounded and driven by his friends to the front of the school for help. Police were assigned to the school for the game and provided first aid to the unresponsive victim until he was transported to the hospital. Attendees inside the gym were locked down for 45 minutes. The shooter fled immediately after the shooting and was not identified.

Summary: Female student was shot during fight between two students
Narrative: According to the Richmond County Sheriff’s Office, deputies responded at 9:14 A.M. to Koger Street at Eagles Way in reference to the shooting. A representative with Richmond County Schools tells us that an altercation between a student from Murphey Middle School and a student from the Alternative School at Morgan Road resulted in one student being shot. The female student was transported by EMS to the hospital for treatment. Both Josey High School and Murphey Middle School were placed on lockdown. Jenkins-White Elementary School and Wilkinson Gardens Elementary also secured their schools. All 4 have since lifted their lockdowns.

Summary: Student shot multiple times outside school during dismissal
Narrative: 15-year-old student was shot multiple times outside the school during dismissal. Shooter fled. Teen was taken to the hospital in critical condition. Shooting as record on CCTV. Police believe the shooting started as an attempted robbery.

Summary: Parent ambushed by four gunman waiting in parking lot after youth basketball game
Narrative: A parent was shot to death in the parking lot of Hillcrest High School in Country Club Hills during a basketball tournament Saturday, according to officials. According to Bremen High School District 228, a parent attending a junior high school boys' basketball tournament taking place at the school was shot in the school's parking lot. Authorities said multiple armed suspects waited in a black 4-door Infiniti Q50 for the man and his son to exit the tournament in the school's parking lot. Shortly before 1:10 p.m., the man was seen leaving the high school with his son, at which time the suspects moved towards the man in the vehicle and blocked his path to his vehicle, police said. Multiple armed suspects then exited the vehicle and opened fire on the man before fleeing the scene southbound through the parking lot towards Pulaski Road, according to authorities.

Summary: Teen with duffle bag attempted to enter school, ran away when confronted by staff, had photo with rifle on social media
Narrative: Officials said a 13-year-old middle school student showed up at Roosevelt Elementary School with a backpack and a black duffel bag. Staff approached the teen as he tried to get in a side entrance. He ran away, but hours later police located him. He surrendered and was arrested, and no injuries were reported. As CBS 58 reported, Kenosha police obtained video of the suspect holding a semi-automatic rifle in a home. Investigators also found internet searches for school shootings and said he made comments to other students about shootings. Search of his home later turned up only replica firearms, not any real guns.

Summary: Student shot during fight at lunch
Narrative: Based on the preliminary investigation, detectives believe around 12:15 p.m. on Thursday, November 7, 2024, a group of teenagers gathered in a parking lot on high school property. Many of the teenagers appeared to know each other and appeared to be involved in an ongoing conflict. At some point, someone discharged a firearm, and a bullet struck the 15-year-old. Immediately after, everyone left the parking lot in various directions, including the 15-year-old. A family member of the 15-year-old drove him to the hospital after he returned home injured. Despite there being several witnesses, no one reported the incident to SLC911, SLCPD SROs, or school officials. Between 12 a.m. and 5 p.m. on November 7, 2024, there were only four calls for service at West High School. Three of the four calls for service occurred before 10 a.m. and the fourth call was the call made from the hospital.

Summary: School constable's firearm accidentally discharged in a school hallway
Narrative: No one was injured Wednesday after a Stanton Middle School constable's firearm accidentally discharged in a school hallway, Principal Matt Robinson said in an email to parents. According to the email, the constable was "repositioning his weapon in his holster" when it fired. "We're relieved to share that no one was hurt, and students were safely in class at the time," Robinson wrote. He said the school is reviewing its safety protocols and Delaware State Police has been asked to investigate "in accordance with district and law enforcement protocols."

Summary: Man fatally shot outside the school during afternoon classes
Narrative: This afternoon, there were reports of shots fired outdoors in the area near our school building. We immediately went on soft lockdown and contacted the Chicago Police Department (CPD) and CPS Office of Safety and Security. CPD then responded to our school and lifted our lockdown once they confirmed it was safe to do so. All students and staff are safe. Out of an abundance of caution, we will receive extra support from CPD during our arrival and dismissal this week.

Summary: Child fired shot with unsecured gun inside car during student drop off
Narrative: A hunting rifle went off in a family's car Tuesday morning during drop-off at a school in Scio, according to an email sent to Scio School District families. The shot was fired in the back parking lot of Centennial Elementary School at 7:45 a.m., and no one was hurt, interim superintendent Kim Roth said in the email. The family had been on a recent hunting trip and thought the rifle had been emptied, the email said. A young child in the backseat was touching the rifle when it went off under the driver's seat. Police were called and were on the scene to investigate. "As a rural community, many of our families participate in hunting as a cherished hobby and tradition," Roth said in the email. "Please remember that in accordance with the federal Gun-Free School Zones Act, firearms are not allowed on campus."

Summary: 13-year-old girl shot herself on the school bus
Narrative: A middle school student is in the hospital in stable condition after St. Petersburg police say she shot herself on a school bus Tuesday morning. It happened around 9:20 a.m. near 49th Street North and 17th Avenue North. Police say there were 20 students headed to Tyrone Middle School on board the bus when the shooting occurred. Yolanda Fernandez, the community awareness division manager of the St. Pete Police Department, said no one else was hurt or threatened, and that the 13-year-old brought the gun onboard. The bus driver heard a pop, and students yelled that someone had been shot, Fernandez said. The bus driver pulled over about a block away where she saw a police officer and flagged him down for help.

Summary: Group of teens fired BB gun at school bus and broke a window with students aboard
Narrative: School Bus 251 was traveling in the area of East Tenth and North Graham Avenue with some of our students when one of the windows shattered. No one was injured. Winston-Salem Police are investigating whether a BB gun was used to shoot the window. If your student is concerned about what happened, please know a school counselor is available to help. Please let us know how we can support you and your family. When responding officers arrived at the scene, they said a group of people shot the BB gun at a school bus, hitting it. WXII crews on the scene said the bus was from WS/FCS.

Summary: Bullets broke two windows of the school taking students to school
Narrative: "The bus department called and said there were two shots fired through the window, and the suspect drove off erratically," she said. An East Irondequoit Central School District bus was transporting 10 students to Aquinas, westbound on State Route 104 near Portland Avenue around 7:30 a.m., when two bus windows shattered, according to the district. Aquinas said all students who were on the bus arrived at school shortly after the incident and met with counselors.

Summary: Child and adult shot on the school playground at dismissal
Narrative: At 3:25 p.m., the girl and the man, 45, were standing on the sidewalk near the south playlot outside William C. Goudy Technology Academy, 5120 N. Winthrop Ave. The playlot fronts Winona Street just south of Foster Avenue. The students at the school had just been dismissed for the day. Police said the man and the girl were both struck by unknown gunfire. The 9-year-old girl suffered a graze wound to the calf and was taken to Lurie Children's Hospital in good condition, police said. A 45-year-old man was shot in the arm, and officials said he ran into the school for help. The principal said teachers helped put pressure on his wound until help arrived.

Summary: Off-duty police officer shot at a woman during a domestic dispute at drop off, subdued by SRO
Narrative: Cleveland police have confirmed the suspect taken into custody is an off-duty police officer of theirs. A post to the Riverside Local Schools Facebook page confirms the domestic dispute began off-site and carried into the Riverview Elementary parking lot. Lake County Sheriff Frank Leonbruno took to Facebook to clarify details. Leonbruno posted to the Sheriff's Office account that the incident began off campus and moved on campus when the suspect’s vehicle collided with another vehicle. The Sheriff’s Office confirmed a single round was fired through the windshield of the second vehicle.

Summary: Unattended child fired shot at the school building with a gun found inside a car
Narrative: Authorities say a 5 year old student who was left in a vehicle unattended got a hold of his mother’s gun. And fired a shot into the building. No injuries. Mother was arrested.

Summary: Shots fired at a vehicle parked in the school parking lot
Narrative: Meridian High School was placed on lockdown following reports of shots fired in the vicinity. MPSD Campus Police quickly responded to the scene and confirmed that no injuries occurred on campus. During the investigation, authorities discovered that a vehicle parked on campus had been targeted, suspected to be an act of vandalism. MPSD Campus Police, in conjunction with the Meridian Police Department, are actively investigating the incident. One individual has been taken into custody as part of the ongoing investigation. However, police are still searching for an additional suspect who fled the area on foot.

Summary: Three people were shot on the school baseball field
Narrative: Deputies were dispatched to the Union Medical Center regarding a shooting victim around 1:30 p.m. Sunday. When deputies arrived, they found a victim in the emergency room. Shortly after, deputies were notified of a second shooting victim who arrived at Union Medical. While interviewing the victims, another victim called 911 and was transported to the hospital as well. According to officials, the victims were shot while at the Buffalo ballfield near Buffalo Elementary School outside of Union, South Carolina.

Summary: School bus window was hit by projectile while driving students home
Narrative: A Chamberlain School District bus carrying seven students was struck by an unknown projectile while en route to drop them off after school on Friday, Oct. 25, 2024. The incident likely occurred toward the end of the bus route, which typically runs from 3:30 to 5 p.m. It resulted in a crack in a window on the passenger side of the bus. No students were injured in the inciden

Summary: Man was fatally shot during the homecoming game tailgate outside the stadium
Narrative: A shooting outside the tailgate area in St. Martinville around 6:30 p.m. has resulted in the death of one individual, authorities confirmed. The incident forced the cancellation of tonight’s high school football game as police and emergency responders secured the scene. 22-year-old man fatally shot a 24-year-old man and fled the area. He was arrested the following day in Texas.

Summary: Man with pistol and AR-15 rifle fired shots into the air outside the school causing a lockdown
Narrative: Just before 8a.m. Thursday, the Phillips County Sheriff's Office received a call that there was an individual shooting a gun south of the middle school in Phillipsburg, according to a social media report from the sheriff. A deputy who was patrolling school zones in Phillipsburg arrived shortly. The Deputy began shouting orders and then the individual dropped both weapons and laid them on the ground. From eyewitness statements it has been concluded that he fired two shots into the air with a 9mm Pistol, but also had an AR Rifle on his person as well, according to the sheriff's office. He was transported to Phillips County Jail where he is being mentally screened. There were multiple people in the area who helped get the kids to safety at the nearby school and others who attempted to control the situation. Sheriff Kyle Pinkerton said, “We should all be proud of how our community reacted, it was quick, and everyone prioritized the safety of our children, and also to the Deputies that responded and ran directly to the threat and ended it."

Summary: Teen with BB gun shot 3 security cameras and a window at the school
Narrative: Around 1 a.m. Wednesday, and that “a juvenile” was caught on security tape on a bicycle with a BB gun. “This wasn't a drive-by,” Graeser said. “This had nothing to do with what happened at the fairgrounds [where a student from the district was shot]. This was mischievous vandalism.” Graeser said the suspect had been identified. No students were on campus at the time of the incident and no injuries were reported. The lieutenant said that some administrators, teachers, and staff noticed the damage when they arrived at school for the day.

Summary: Man was shot in front of the school
Narrative: According to MPD, officers responded to the shooting call on Tuesday night just before 11:30 p.m. at 3212 Raleigh Millington Road in front of Coleman Elementary. Upon arrival, they found a man lying on the sidewalk with a gunshot wound to his left buttocks. The victim told police that he was driving down Raleigh Millington Road when two cars pulled up and began shooting at his car. The victim was taken to Regional One Hospital in critical condition. A parent said the school did not inform the parents of the shooting. “Good thing it was last night because this is where my three children go. If I would have known about it they would have not been at school today,” he said.
Accomplice_Narrative: People in two cars fired shots at the victim

Summary: Teenage boy shot a teenage girl on the school playground during a dispute
Narrative: 15-year-old male shot a 15-year-old female on the school playground during a dispute. The boy fled and was arrested away from the school. The girl was transported to a hospital.

Summary: Teen fired shots, ditched his gun on school property, and refused to leave the campus when police arrived
Narrative: A suspect is in custody after shots were reportedly fired near McDonald Elementary School in Georgetown County Tuesday morning. According to the Georgetown County Sheriff's Office, the suspect admitted to having a firearm but said he threw it somewhere on school property. Several units, including a K-9 team, searched for the gun. The suspect is detained at the Georgetown County Detention Center. McDonald School is on lockout status but the school is admitting students and normal operations are continuing. Suspected charged with disturbing school grounds and resisting arrest.

Summary: Student fired shot during a fight at dismissal
Narrative: A student who allegedly fired a gunshot during dismissal at East Technical High School on Tuesday is now in police custody. No students or staff were injured, according to a statement from the Cleveland Metropolitan School District sent to FOX 8 News. The school district’s security team reported a current student and former student of the school were involved in an altercation in front of the school. Police apprehended the student who allegedly fired the shot, but they're still seeking the other student, who reportedly fled the scene. A CMSD security officer was able to get the gun from the individual. The suspect got into a car and sped off.

Summary: Two men shot during fight at youth football game
Narrative: Two adults were injured following a shooting at a youth football game Sunday evening at Walnut Hills High in Cincinnati, OH. The shooting took place around 7:30 p.m. as one of the scheduled games was just beginning to wrap up. A local news reporter witnessed numerous kids crying upon arriving on the scene. Police said that the shooting appears to have happened after an argument broke out between a group of adult men at the PeeWee football game.

Summary: Man fatally shot in school parking lot
Narrative: Birmingham man was fatally shot Friday in a high school parking lot in Selma, authorities said Thursday. Selma police responded to Southside High School at 7975 U.S. Highway 80 East in Selma around 11 p.m. Friday on a report of shots fired in the area, according to Central Alabama Crimestoppers, which is offering a $1,000 reward for information that leads to an arrest in the homicide investigation. Authorities located the victim, later identified as 32-year-old Birmingham resident, with a gunshot wound near Water Avenue and Broad Street in Selma. Hall was pronounced dead at the scene. Investigators determined the shooting occurred in the Southside High School parking lot.

Summary: Man with BB gun fired at cars and stared into the school yard where students were, school went on lockdown
Narrative: On Hawaii Island, a man was arrested after allegedly firing a BB gun at cars near Hookena Elementary School on Friday morning, according to Hawaii Island police officials. Officials say officers were called out to an area of Mamalahoa Highway just before 7 a.m. near the school. The school was put into lockdown after employees reportedly saw the armed 38-year-old staring into the schoolyard where students were playing, officials say. Hawaii Police Department also received multiple calls that the man was shooting at cars as they passed by. Police disarmed the man and took him into custody. He now faces two counts of terroristic threatening.

Summary: Shots fired in parking lot after high school football game
Narrative: Dover Police took two people into custody Friday night after a football game at Dover High School. Around 9 p.m. a gunshot was fired. Police at the scene to staff the game, which had concluded at this point, responded as a crowd dispersed at the sound of the gunshot. Several more police vehicles arrived at the school shortly after. A Dover Police spokesperson said no injuries have been reported. The game between Dover and Smyrna concluded around 8:25 p.m. Some people remained inside the stadium to watch a post-game drum line performance, while others congregated just outside the stadium fence.

Summary: Construction worker shot himself in the leg in the school parking lot
Narrative: A construction worker accidentally shot himself while in his car on Lafayette High School's campus Thursday, according to authorities. The school was not notified of the shooting until after police arrived, according to a Lafayette Parish School System announcement. No students were in danger, officials said. The shooting occurred at 12:09 p.m., according to Corporal Ashley Wood, a  Lafayette Police Department spokesperson, when a Lemoine construction worker accidentally fired one shot into his hand and lower leg in his vehicle. The worker was handling the firearm when it accidentally fired.

Summary: Parent shot behind school before student pickup, shooter entered the school and left the gun inside the school before fleeing
Narrative: An adult male parent was shot behind the Islamic School of Portland on Thursday afternoon. A parent was shot during a dispute with another parent before student pick-up. When they arrived, officers found a man who was wounded outside the school. He was taken to an area hospital for treatment. Officers learned the accused shooter entered the Islamic School of Portland, left his gun inside the school building, he exited the building, and was taken into custody without incident.

Summary: Student shot himself in the parking lot while putting a gun away in his car
Narrative: Louisville Metro police officers have been called to Atherton High School on Dundee Road after a self-inflicted shooting happened Thursday morning. An official with JCPS said the student accidentally shot himself in the parking lot while putting the gun away. The student was taken to a hospital.

Summary: Teen shot in the head on the school basketball court
Narrative: An 18-year-old is in critical condition after he was shot near a Brooklyn middle school on Wednesday, according to police. An NYPD spokesperson said the shooting happened around 5:40 p.m. at Flatlands Avenue and East 81st Street near I.S. 68 Isaac Bildersee in Canarsie. When officers arrived, they found the teen suffering from a gunshot wound to his head. The teen was taken to Brookdale Hospital Medical Center in critical condition. It was one shot, he was lying there in the school compound in the (Bildersee Playground) park,” a witness told the Daily News. “He was bleeding, he was bleeding from the head… it was horrible."

Summary: Parent brandished gun during dispute at student drop off
Narrative: The Huntsville Police Department released a statement on the incident. On Tuesday, Oct. 15, just before 8:00 a.m., a female victim reported being involved in a road rage incident. The suspect confronted the victim in the Huntsville High School drop off line. The suspect got out of their vehicle with a firearm and made a threat to the victim. The suspect then got back into their vehicle and fled the scene. School Resource Officers were on scene of the incident; however, by the time they were notified the suspect had already fled. A criminal case was made for Menacing. This incident is under active investigation.

Summary: Police fatally shot driver of vehicle that crashed onto the school's field following chase, school locked down
Narrative: After a high speed chase, a man crashed his vehicle near the football field and bleachers by the front bus circle at the school. He then got out of the truck with a 9mm semi-automatic rifle and was told by officers to put the gun down and lay on the ground. He obeyed, but as officers approached, he picked up the rifle and pointed it at them while prone on the ground. The officers immediately opened fire, mortally wounding him. The man was given immediate first aid, but he was pronounced dead at the scene. Officers fired 25 shots. The school went on lockdown.

Summary: Man fatally shot during dispute at youth football game
Narrative: According to the medical examiner's office, the victim was shot at a flag football game. Milwaukee Public Schools said South Stadium was cleared due to an incident during a youth flag football game – and all other games scheduled for Saturday were canceled. The video also shows two other men leaving from the bleacher area. As everyone is walking down the ramp towards the concession area, one of the following men starts running towards Avalos-Morales and his companion. The man jogs past the victim and runs straight at the man with Avalos-Morales, jumping in the air and punching him, starting a fight. As this is happening, Avalos-Morales can be seen on the video withdrawing a firearm from his clothes, appears to ready the firearm and then turns in the direction of the victim, who appears to be moving past Avalos-Morales and the two fighting men.

Summary: Teen fired rifle during fight outside football stadium
Narrative: A football game at Ooltewah High School was disrupted Friday night when shots were fired near the tennis courts. Now, authorities say a 19-year-old faces charges. Hamilton County Sheriff's Office (HCSO) Deputies arrived at the scene around 9:40 p.m. after receiving reports of gunfire during a game between two visiting teams. (The Ooltewah High School team was not involved in the match). HCSO says the suspect, later identified as Connor Shannon, told deputies that he fired a shot into the air to break up a fight involving his cousins. Deputies found two firearms in Shannon's vehicle, including a rifle with a spent casing jammed in the chamber, according to HCSO's release. Shannon was detained and taken to the Hamilton County Jail. He's been charged with reckless endangerment and carrying weapons on school property.

Summary: Shots fired during during fight at pep rally
Narrative: Police say they learned that a fight had broken out between several adults in the parking lot of the school’s gym where students were having a homecoming pep rally. They believe those adults were “associated with artists invited by the school to entertain at the rally.” At one point, one of the suspects who was in his car fired three shots into the air. That person was able to drive away in a Mercedes before other officers arrived.

Summary: Shots fired while students were on the school playground
Narrative: Police said a car drove by and fired multiple shots at two young men who were walking along S. Ewing Avenue. They were not hurt. Witnesses said the school security jumped into action to make sure all students were safe. A student and his mother described some scary moments. "It's sad, and it's scary at the same time," said Christopher, a 7th grader. "The teachers told us there was somebody outside. Someone shot, and they put us inside the classrooms." "It was loud, big caliber. And I looked out the window as soon as it happened and the kids were on the ground and then they shuffled them back here. And the security guard ran around the end of the building toward where the fire was with his gun out," said John McNeely, a nearby business owner. Police said there were a few students outside the building at the time of the shooting, but none were hurt.

Summary: Two students fired 8 shots at school bus during planned attack targeting a student on the bus
Narrative: 17-year-old was arrested and charged with aggravated assault on Friday after he was allegedly part of a group that opened fire on a school bus in Coatesville. Officials believe that he met up with a group waiting near a bus stop to conduct the assault. Eight shots were fired at the bus by two shooters from about a block away, reported Fox 29.According to the Coatesville Area School District, a driver was transporting high school students when a bullet went through the windshield. The gunfire rang out around 2:30 p.m. at the corner of Hope Avenue and Madison Street. No one on the bus was hit and no injuries were reported. "Students on the bus are safe, as is the driver, and police are on the scene. We are extremely grateful for the calm reaction of our driver and the support of police," the school district said in a statement. The bus company, Krapf School Bus, tells Action News the driver called dispatch who then called the police. The driver then traveled about two miles away to the Westwood Fire Company, where parents and students were reunited, officials said. "She kept those kids safe. She kept herself safe and she made sure that she got away from the situation like she should have," said Nikki Batt, who also works as a school bus driver. As a result of the shooting, Thursday night's football game against Downingtown East High School was canceled. Carmen Lemus, also a bus driver, was set to transport kids to the game.

Summary: Bullets fired during drive-by broke occupied classroom window
Narrative: Nova High School was placed on lockdown, and Garfield High School was in shelter-in-place after Seattle police responded to shots being fired near both schools Thursday afternoon. According to the Seattle Police Department, officers responded to the 2400 block of East Cherry Street at 1:44 p.m. near Nova High School. Police said a suspected .45 caliber bullet went through a second-story window of the school. The SPD told KOMO News the bullet was being recovered as evidence. A department spokesperson said a 911 caller reported hearing six to seven shots being fired. Responding officers found more than a dozen shell casings on 25th Avenue near the school. A witness also told 911 dispatchers that two vehicles were allegedly seen fleeing the area. Investigators believe the vehicles were involved in the shooting. At this time, it is unknown if the shots were aimed at the school. No injuries have been reported at this time. "Students and staff at both schools are safe, and the lockdown and shelter-in-place have been lifted," wrote Seattle Public Schools in response to an inquiry from KOMO News.

Summary: Masked man with AR-15 fired shot in front of the school
Narrative: Wednesday evening reports came into Muskegon dispatch that there was a masked man outside of Marquette Elementary School shooting off an AR-15. Muskegon dispatch confirmed the reports to 13 ON YOUR SIDE. They said the alleged incident occurred just before 6 p.m. Witnesses told them that nobody was shot in the incident.

Summary: Teen shot in parking lot behind school, found dead at nearby house
Narrative: Rochester police officers are currently investigating after a person was found dead on Flint Street Monday evening after being shot in a school parking lot. When officers arrived to the area of Flint Street at around 6 p.m., RPD said a man in his late teens was found dead from multiple gunshot wounds on the porch of a vacant house. Investigators said the victim was shot in the rear lot of Charles T. Lunsford School #19 on Seward Street at around 4 p.m. Monday. RPD said the victim was able to run to the porch on Flint Street where he was found, and died due to his injuries. Rochester police were notified of the unresponsive victim due to a passerby seeing him on the porch, and calling 911.

Summary: Man with rifle in school parking lot fired shots at two police officers then barricaded inside nearby house for 4 hours
Narrative: The start of school was delayed at Poteet High School in Mesquite on Monday because of an officer-involved shooting near the campus. Sgt. Curtis Phillip with the Mesquite Police Department said it all started after police got a call just before 4 a.m. on Monday about someone with a knife at the Whataburger restaurant on Galloway Avenue. The man left the restaurant before officers arrived, but he later called and said he was near Poteet High School. Sgt. Phillip said the officers found the suspect in the 3300 block of Poteet Drive. "He did have a long gun. Shots were exchanged between the suspect and our officers. Two officers fired. Neither officer was struck. The suspect was not struck either," he said. The suspect fled to a home in the 700 block of Southwynd Street and barricaded himself inside. He was arrested just after 8 a.m. School had a delayed opening due to police investigation in the parking lot.

Summary: Person shot outside football stadium during game
