Narrative: With 4:21 left in the non-district high school football game, gunshots could be heard just outside the south side of stadium as fans, players, referees hit the turf or ran for cover.Police with their guns drawn could be seen rushing to the back of the south end zone and out of the stadium. A school authority said two victims possibly suffered gunshot wounds. Broward Sheriff’s Office Pompano Beach District deputies, while working the football game at Blanche Ely High School, responded to a shots fired report in the area, shortly after 7:30 p.m. on Saturday. Just outside the venue, deputies located one person suffering from a gunshot wound. They immediately provided life-saving measures before the victim was transported to a local hospital. The victim’s injuries are listed as not life-threatening, and they are expected to recover. BSO Violent Crimes Unit detectives are currently investigating the incident.

Summary: Two adults shot during dispute at end of youth football game
Narrative: According to the Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department, officers responded to the school around 10:18 p.m. after receiving a report that indicated multiple people had been shot there. Initially, first responders were led to believe children had been shot. After further investigation, however, IMPD determined two adult males were the only subjects injured during the shooting. Police reported that one victim was transported to a local hospital in critical condition. Per IMPD, the other victim was deemed to be in stable condition after the shooting. Law enforcement later learned a youth football game had ended moments before shots rang out in the school’s parking lot. Police currently believe an argument pertaining to the game was what instigated the shooting.

Summary: Man shot during dispute at youth football game
Narrative: Pikes Peak Pop Warner President Michelle Quintana shared the following statement with News5. "We want to address the unfortunate incident that occurred during our Pop Warner games at Atlas Prep this afternoon. This situation was not related to our teams; it involved two individuals with prior personal issues who do not have children in our league and do not participate in any coaching or volunteer roles. The safety of our athletes and their families is our top priority, and we are implementing additional measures to ensure their continued safety in the future. Our thoughts and prayers are with the victims' family during this difficult time." Colorado Springs Police say the shooting happened after a fight broke out. They say the victim was a 29 year old man, but his name has not been released. Police say no arrests have been made and no suspect information is available.

Summary: Man fatally shot inside vehicle before youth football game
Narrative: A man was shot to death Saturday morning in the parking lot of St. John Bosco High School in Bellflower, where he came to watch his son play in a youth football game at the school stadium, authorities said. The victim was sitting inside a white Audi that had been reported stolen, the Los Angeles County Sheriff’s Department said, and when deputies arrived around 8:20 a.m., they found him in the car suffering from gunshot wounds alongside a female passenger who was uninjured. The man was rushed to a hospital but died. Authorities said the suspect fled the scene in a white sedan heading south on Bellflower Boulevard.

Summary: Woman fired gun outside football stadium during homecoming game
Narrative: A woman has been charged after firing a gun after a Carver High School football game, according to the Forsyth County Sheriff’s Office. On Friday, deputies say people were leaving the school’s football stadium after homecoming festivities at the school when she allegedly pulled out a gun and fired a gunshot on school property. No one was hurt.

Summary: Gun fired inside student's backpack while on the school bus
Narrative: Sheriff Brian Spillman says that both students, aged 14, had brought guns to school after agreeing to “swap” weapons with each other. “Our investigation has revealed that both students possessed handguns at school on Tuesday and exchanged them during the school day. There is no indication that either student brought the weapons with the intent to use them at school; rather, they agreed to swap guns and used the school as the point of exchange. Additionally, both weapons had been reported stolen recently,” said Sheriff Spillman. Spillman added that both are fourteen years old and are in custody awaiting a continued custody hearing. West Feliciana Parish Schools Superintendent Hollis Milton stated in a release on Tuesday that, following the bus routes on October 1, a loud noise was reported during an afternoon route on a school bus. This incident was communicated to the West Feliciana High School administration. Initially, the students and bus driver believed the noise was a firecracker. However, upon further investigation, the administration discovered that a high school student had allegedly brought a gun on the bus, which discharged inside the student’s backpack.
Accomplice_Narrative: Two students brough guns to school to exchange weapons

School: Emil G. Hirsch Metropolitan High School
Summary: Teen was shot while standing behind school when 30 shot were fired from a vehicle
Narrative: Police said at 9:56 a.m., the teen was standing outside in the 7700 block of South Drexel Avenue when four people got out of a white sedan and fired at least 30 shots. The victim was hit in the shoulder and was taken to the University of Chicago Medical Center in good condition. More than 50 evidence markers were seen on the pavement as police investigated. Hirsch Metropolitan High School is located at 7740 S. Ingleside Ave., with its main entrance fronting Grand Crossing Park. The back of the school is located on the same block of Drexel Avenue where the shooting happened.

Summary: Teen was shot while standing in front of the school
Narrative: A 19-year-old man was being treated for a gunshot wound to the chest after being shot Monday evening near an Oceanside middle school, police said. The teen was shot in front of Cesar Chavez Middle School on Oleander Drive around 6:25 p.m. When police arrived they found the man with a gunshot wound to the right side of his chest, said Oceanside police Sgt. Mark Bussey. Paramedics transported him to a hospital, where he is being treated for injuries not believed to be life-threatening, Bussey said. Investigators located three 9 mm shell casings in the parking lot at the school, and a witness reported seeing someone shooting from the rear passenger seat of an SUV with silver trim. The vehicle was last seen heading east on Oleander Drive. Police believe the shooting was gang-related, Bussey said.

Summary: Two teens shot during fight in the parking lot during a high school football game
Narrative: Police are investigating after two teenagers were shot in the Pleasure Ridge Park High School parking lot during a football game. According to police, they responded to reports of that shooting at 8:02 p.m. Sunday evening. Once officers arrived, they found a male juvenile who had been shot multiple times. He was taken to University Hospital to be treated and is currently in critical condition. Police say the second victim showed up to Mary & Elizabeth Hospital to be treated but is expected to be OK. PRP was playing Male because storms postponed the game that was originally scheduled for Friday night.

Summary: Security guard working for the visiting team accidentally shot himself during high school football game
Narrative: A former police officer working as a security guard for the visiting team accidentally shot himself at Friday night's football game between Wisconsin Lutheran and Milwaukee Lutheran. He tried to grab his gun as it slipped out of his pants waistband and fired a shot striking himself in the leg. The security guard received treatment, and his injuries are not believed to be life-threatening. After the gunshot, students, players and spectators immediately evacuated the stadium. The game was ended by mutual consent, the school said.

Summary: Teen shot man in the school parking lot, school closed the following day
Narrative: 17-year-old shot an adult man in the school parking lot. The school was closed the following day while police investigated.

Summary: Two teens shot outside school at dismissal
Narrative:
Two teenage boys were shot on a Brooklyn street Wednesday afternoon near a junior high school.
Cops responded to a 911 call at Avenue J and 82nd St. next to Intermediate School 68 Isaac Bildersee in Canarsie around 3:13 p.m. They found a 17-year-old with multiple gunshot wounds to the leg and torso, and another youth, also 17, shot twice in the leg. Both boys were reported to be in stable condition. EMS transported the more seriously wounded of the pair to Brookdale University Hospital. The other, with gunshot wounds to the leg only, was transported by private means to Kings County Hospital. There were no reported arrests, and the investigation was ongoing. It was unclear if the school went into lockdown after the shooting.

Summary: 15-year-old fired shots outside school at dismissal
Narrative: According to an official statement released by Freire, shots were fired outside the school building on East 15th Street. While no injuries were reported, law enforcement officers immediately secured the scene. School administrators made the decision to keep students inside until law enforcement confirmed the area was safe. In connection with the incident, Wilmington Police apprehended a 15-year-old male juvenile who was found fleeing the scene. The suspect was taken into custody without incident and was discovered to be in possession of a loaded .380 caliber handgun, which had been reported as stolen police said. The juvenile faces multiple charges, including possession of a firearm by a person prohibited, receiving a stolen firearm, and discharging a firearm on a city street.

Summary: Two people shot outside of school during afternoon classes
Narrative: According to KCPD, dispatch received reports of a shooting at about 1 p.m. Tuesday in the area of East 85th Street and Highland Avenue — an intersection near Center School District’s Center Academy for Success. Upon arrival, officers found two shooting victims at the scene. KCPD has not released any more details about the shooting, including the status of the two victims.

Summary: Student shot outside school during dismissal
Narrative: According to police sources, officers from 63rd Precinct and an army of school safety officers rushed to South Shore High School in Flatlands at around 2:44 p.m. on Sept. 24 as students were being dismissed. The responding cops found the victim, a 15-year-old boy, near the corner of East 58th Street and Glenwood Avenue lying in a pool of blood, with a gunshot wound to the right leg. Several bullet casings were scattered at the location. EMS rushed the victim to Brookdale University Hospital, where he is expected to survive his injuries.

Summary: Teen pulled gun during fight between multiple students on sidewalk next to athletic fields
Narrative: Cellphone video shows a teen pulled gun during fight between multiple students on sidewalk next to athletic fields.

Summary: Man shot wife during dispute at student drop off
Narrative: A shooting outside Cessna Elementary School while class was in session came after woman told father of her children she wanted to leave him. “We have a domestic dispute,” Sheriff Jeff Easter, Sedgwick County, said. “A husband and wife were brought here along with their kids by a Lyft driver. The kids went on into school. We have witnesses telling us the male suspect shot the female in the chest.” He said the woman ran toward the school to get help, and the man chased her. Easter said a deputy arrived and saw the man pointing a gun at the woman’s head. “The deputy took cover, and then when the suspect stepped a little bit away from our victim, the deputy shot the suspect,” Easter said. The sheriff said the deputy went to the man to take him into custody, and the man tried to fight him, but the deputy got him into custody. Easter said both victims are in critical condition. Other children were entering the school then, and a school district person tried to shield them from seeing what was happening.

Summary: Teen shot outside of school
Narrative: The shooting happened around 5:14 p.m. in the 5700 block of South Wolcott Avenue, right by Henderson Elementary School. The victim, a 15-year-old boy, was standing near a sidewalk at the location when an unknown vehicle pulled up and at least one person from inside got out and began to shoot at him, police said. The boy was shot multiple times in the legs, police said. He was taken to Comer Children's Hospital, where he was initially listed in critical condition.

Summary: 16-year-old was fatally shot in the grass next to the school
Narrative: A teenager was found dead on the property of Martin Luther King High School in Philadelphia's East Mt. Airy section Sunday night. It happened around 11:45 p.m. on the 5900 block of Stenton Avenue. Police say a passerby noticed a body in the grass near the school and called police. Three shell casing were found near the victim who was shot in the chest.

Summary: Person shot during event on the football field
Narrative: Person was shot during a community event in the high school football stadium.

Summary: Student shot during fight at marching band practice
Narrative: The DeRidder Police Department received a report from Beauregard Health System at approximately 11:32 p.m. of a juvenile with a gunshot wound, prompting an investigation, according to a statement from police. The investigation revealed that Anthony Ray Goldman, 18, of Cleveland, Texas, was at the band practice field on Oneal Street around 9:44 p.m. when he allegedly fired several rounds from a .22-caliber handgun, striking a juvenile. A physical altercation between Goldman and the juvenile reportedly followed.

Summary: SRO shot himself in the leg in the parking lot before a high school football game
Narrative: “At approximately 5:55 this evening, an MFISD school resource officer (SRO) experienced an accidental discharge of his firearm while seated inside the holster. This subsequently resulted in a non-life-threatening injury to his leg. The officer was on MFHS property near the visitor parking area. He has been transported via helicopter. The visitor parking area experienced disruption for a short period, but it is open as of 6:32pm.

Summary: Man hunting nearby fired 6 shots that hit the school as students were arriving
Narrative: A hunter has been arrested in connection to a shots fired incident that closed Sharon Dawes Elementary School in Eastern Kanawha County on Friday. The Kanawha County Sheriff’s Office says authorities responded to the school Friday, Sept. 20, around 7:45 a.m. after maintenance workers on the roof heard shots and the sounds of pellets hitting the roof. As part of the investigation, authorities questioned hunters, in case the incident had been a “careless and dangerous mistake” from a hunter. During the investigation, authorities learned James L. Wilson, 50, of Miami, West Virginia, was squirrel hunting on a hill near the school with a 12 gauge Remington 870, according to the complaint. The complaint also states that the maintenance workers heard about four to six gunshots coming from the hill and that approximately seventeen pellets “consistent with a shotgun shell” were found on the school’s roof. The complaint says that during the investigation, Wilson, who was one of the hunters questioned, showed officers where a squirrel was shot during the incident. Authorities said the shot was “in line with the direction of Sharon Dawes Elementary School.” Authorities also said they learned that Wilson did not have an active hunting license, the complaint states. According to the complaint, Wilson was arrested for hunting without a license, illegal possession of wildlife and negligent shooting.

Summary: High school football player shot during game, shots were fired from the parking lot of the stadium
Narrative: A Woodward high school athlete was hurt in a shooting during the school’s football game at North College Hill, Cincinnati Public Schools said. Shots rang out around 8:15 p.m. just 500 feet from the stadium, behind the elementary school, according to NCH Superintendent Eugene Blalock. He said someone fired shots at the elementary school. “Tonight, a Woodward Career Technical High School student-athlete was injured in a shooting during the school’s football game at North College Hill, Cincinnati Public school district said in a statement. “Cincinnati Public Schools recognizes this tragic event and our support remains with the student, their family, friends and school community. CPS’ Crisis Response Team will be on-site to provide support to students as they return to school Tuesday.” The game ended early and now this will be the last home game North College Hill will play this season, according to the NCH superintendent.

Summary: 15-year-old student fatally shot while getting off the school bus
Narrative: 15-year-old student was fatally shot while getting off of the school bus at dismissal. The teen was a student in the Muscogee County School District, according to a spokesperson said. Officials reported that the incident impacted students on a school bus. Police from the school district were also on the scene.

Summary: Student shot in the parking lot during afternoon classes
Narrative: A 14-year-old boy was shot and wounded outside a high school in St. Paul on Tuesday afternoon, police said. Police responded at 1:20 p.m. to Washington Technology Magnet School, off Rice Street and Arlington Avenue, on a report of shots fired. They didn’t find evidence of a shooting or victim, and spoke with witnesses to try to determine what happened, said Alyssa Arcand, a St. Paul police spokeswoman. Officers later found a teen who had an apparent gunshot injury to his leg. St. Paul Fire Department medics evaluated him for a non-life-threatening injury, according to Arcand. Police arrested a 16-year-old boy and he was brought to the Ramsey County Juvenile Detention Center, Arcand said. The shooting happened in the school’s parking lot while school was in session, Principals Elias Oguz and Melinda McBride wrote in a letter to parents. The school went into “secure” protocol, which means students or staff who are outside are brought inside. The school’s entrances remained locked, the principals wrote. After-school athletics at the school were canceled Tuesday.

Summary: Police fatally shot carjacking suspect in the grass lawn of the school
Narrative: Police fatally shot a man with a handgun who ran from a traffic stop for a stolen vehicle. The man was shot in front of the school causing a lockdown.

Summary: Three students fired shots at the front door of the school, fled and were arrested off campus
Narrative: Officers responded to a call about property damage at Macon High School around 6:03 a.m. on Friday. When they got there, the officers realized the entrance to the building had been shot. They say the school was placed on lockdown for arriving students, and prior 13WMAZ reporting said the school released early that day. No students or staff were at the school when the shooting happened, per the report. According to the report, officers tracked the teenagers using Flock Camera technology, and located several guns at their home - one of which was stolen. The two older boys are being transferred to Macon County Jail, and the 15-year-old will be held at a Youth Detention Center. This incident is under further investigation by the Federal Bureau of Investigations, Georgia Bureau of Investigations, Georgia Department of Corrections, and the Macon County Sheriff Department.

Summary: Shots fired into the air during fight between adults and students on campus
Narrative: Gunshots rang out on the campus of Frederick Douglass High School on Friday after Atlanta Public Schools said a school bus was followed by two people in a car before engaging in a fight. No students were injured in the gunfire, Atlanta Public Schools officials said. School officials said that one of the activity school buses was followed from the 9th Grade Academy to the main campus of the high school, where two people who have yet to be identified got out of the vehicle and began fighting several students. That's when APS officials said one of the unidentified adults pulled out a gun and started firing shots in the air.

Summary: Parent shot themselves while waiting in the pickup line at dismissal
Narrative: A person in the school pick-up lane had accidentally shot themselves in the leg at dismissal.

Summary: 13-year-old shot during dismissal, school went on lockdown
Narrative: Cincinnati police said officers responded to the 1400 block of John Street just before 4 p.m. for a report of a shooting. A 13-year-old boy was found shot in his arm. He was taken to Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center for treatment and is expected to be OK. Police at the scene said the teen was a student shot shortly after dismissal time. In a statement, Cincinnati Public Schools said its security team responded immediately, bringing students back into the school building after the shooting. Dozens of police units then blocked off the area around the school to investigate. "All after-school activities have been canceled," CPS said in its statement. "As a precaution, there will be additional security and counselors at Taft High School tomorrow to provide continued support for students and staff."

Summary: Two students shot on street outside school, ran inside for help
Narrative: Two teenage boys were shot in Southeast Washington, D.C., on Thursday morning, and ran to a school to get help, police said. Officers found the teens suffering from gunshot wounds just before 10 a.m. in the 3900 block of 8th Street SE in the Washington Highlands area, police said. The KIPP DC Legacy College Preparatory school and a recreation center are in the same block. The teens, believed to be 16 and 17 years old, were conscious and breathing when they were taken to local hospitals, police said. They're expected to survive. Police said the teens ran to the KIPP school, where they're students, for help. Parents and guardians who got word there was a shooting near the school rushed to pick up their children.

Summary: Police officer shot self in the foot while clearing hallways after hoax call
Narrative: On Wednesday morning, September 11th at approximately 9 am., law enforcement and school officials received information that someone may have a gun at Trion High School. A picture of someone holding a rifle (same picture that was used with the threat on Saturday), was sent by a student from another school system to a Trion High School student. Trion City Schools immediately went to a “hard lockdown” while the threat was being investigated. All lockers, vehicles, bookbags, etc. were searched by law enforcement and school officials. No weapon was discovered during the search and investigation. During the “hard lockdown”, law enforcement officials were securing each hallway in the elementary, middle, and high school. A law enforcement officer accidentally discharged his weapon, and shot himself in the foot, while scanning the 2nd and 3rd grade hallway. The officer was transported to receive medical attention. All students and teachers were in their classrooms, and were not in danger. The gunshot was heard by students and staff on the 2nd and 3rd grade hallway.

Summary: Cross country team shot but two students with airsoft guns during practice
Narrative: The Greenville County Sheriff’s Office has arrested a student after an airsoft gun was shot towards Riverside High School athletes. The incident occurred on Tuesday during cross country practice at after 5 p.m. Riverside High School Principal Darah Huffman sent out a message to parents that mentioned two unknown males fired an airsoft or BB gun towards students running through East Riverside Park during practice. On Wednesday, deputies report a 16-year-old Riverside High School student was arrested in connection with the incident.

Summary: Teen pointed handgun a school bus after fight with student before pickup, school went on lockdown
Narrative: "Officers responded and learned that the juvenile male suspect was in an argument with a student using the bus and after the victim entered the bus to leave, the suspect brandished a handgun and pointed it at the school bus," Phoenix Police Sgt. Brian Bower said, according to Fox 10. No shots were fired at the bus, Bower said.

Summary: Student shot during lunch, student shooter fled and was arrested off campus
Narrative: Omaha police arrested a suspect about half an hour after a shooting Tuesday that critically injured a teenage boy. Families rushed to Omaha Northwest High School after the shooting was reported by the school resource officer during lunch at 12:23 p.m. Omaha Police Deputy Chief Sherie Thomas said officers from several departments quickly responded to the school and found the victim inside. Thomas said police believe the shooting was an isolated incident between two students. The suspect was arrested three blocks away about 30 minutes later. Parents tearfully embraced their kids in the parking lot as the first few started to come out of the school after 1 p.m. Police set up a reunification site at the football stadium, but said it would be a long process to release all the students.

Summary: Female student shot during fight at dismissal, ran to school for help and school went on lockdown
Narrative: A teen girl was grazed by a bullet on Monday near a Dallas high school, according to police and district officials. Dallas Police say they responded to a shooting call at about 4:25 p.m. A Dallas ISD spokesperson told WFAA that a teen girl was shot at a Renaissance Park across the street from South Oak Cliff High School, where she attends 9th grade, shortly before dismissal. Sources told WFAA that leading up to the shooting, a group of students was skipping school at the park and a fight broke out. A DISD spokesperson said after the shooting, the girl ran to the school's football field for help. That spokesperson also confirmed that the girl is expected to be okay. Preliminary information indicates the girl was not the target of the shooting, and was just a bystander, a DISD spokesperson said. The spokesperson told WFAA that Dallas Police held dismissal during the start of the investigation. According to the spokesperson, mental health resources will be available to South Oak Cliff High School students on Tuesday. Nearby resident told WFAA he heard four or five gunshots. Deveen Ivroy, explained, "we heard an announcement, 'lockdown, everyone go to the gym,'" he said. "I was scared because it was right by the school, it’s like I always come through [the park] to walk through the school. I was excited to see my mom, because you never know it could have been me."

Summary: Three fans in the stands wounded by shots fired from 100 yards away
Narrative: Police Chief Erin Gibbons quickly released a statement, “At approximately 6:57 p.m., officers responded to reports of shots fired in the area. Witnesses reported seeing individuals fleeing the scene, prompting an immediate and coordinated response from MPD officers. One possible suspect has been located. However, we believe this is only a partial account of the incident, and our investigation is ongoing. With the support of the ATF, an additional K-9 unit, Berkeley County Sheriff’s Office, and task force, we are continuing efforts to locate at least one suspect who remains at large. This unfortunate event impacted the nearby football game, where bullets traveled toward the stands, located approximately 100 to 150 yards from the scene. One victim in the stands was struck, sustaining non-life-threatening injuries. Additionally, at least two others were injured by what is believed to be shrapnel. Thankfully, their injuries were superficial.

Summary: Student fatally shot during fight in bathroom
Narrative: A 15-year-old Joppatowne High School student died after being shot in the chest Friday during an altercation in the school, according to Harford County authorities, who arrested a 16-year-old suspect. Warren Curtis Grant died in a hospital Friday afternoon after being shot during the dispute in a first-story bathroom, Harford County Sheriff Jeff Gahler said at a Friday afternoon news conference. Police did not identify the suspect, a 16-year-old Joppatowne High student, noting they would release his name once he is formally charged as an adult, which Gahler said could be expected later Friday or Saturday morning. Officers responded to the school at about 12:36 p.m. after the single shot struck the teenage victim in the chest, Gahler said. The suspect fled the school grounds, and Grant was dragged out of the bathroom by other students. The wounded 15-year-old was tended to by school personnel, including a nurse, a resource officer and Principal Melissa Williams, before being airlifted to Johns Hopkins Hospital in serious condition, Gahler said during another news conference earlier Friday afternoon.

Summary: Teacher grazed by bullet that broke classroom window
Narrative: Police said a 33-year-old teacher was inside Angelo Patri Middle School, preparing for the first day of school, when a stray bullet came in through a sixth-floor window. The teacher was grazed on the hand, taken to a local hospital to be treated for minor injuries and then released, police said. One other teacher was also inside the classroom at the time, but they were not injured, according to police. Police said there were no children inside or outside the school at the time.

Summary: Staff member pointed gun at student and said he was going to kill him
Narrative: A Kentucky school staff member is facing charges for allegedly threatening a student with a gun. Christopher Collier, 31, has been in jail since being arrested on Thursday. According to police, Collier held a Clay County High School student at gunpoint after getting him into his truck and threatening him.The citation issued to Collier stated that he pointed the gun at the student’s head after the student got into his truck at about 11 a.m. Wednesday. Collier is accused of telling the student he was going to kill him and that he was making a video of it. A sheriff’s deputy arrested Collier Thursday and charged him with criminal trespassing, wanton endangerment, terroristic threatening and unlawful possession of a weapon on school property.

Summary: Planned attack by current student with AR-15 rifle
Narrative: Planned attack by 14-year-old student started inside the school during morning classes. Shooter left class to go to the bathroom and tried to re-enter the locked classroom with an AR-15 rifle.The morning of the shooting, the shooter asked his teacher for permission to go to the front office and speak with an unidentified person, the GBI said. The teacher allowed him to leave and take his belongings with him, the GBI said. The 14-year-old then went to the bathroom and hid from teachers, and later allegedly took out the rifle and started shooting, according to the GBI. Colt Gray was also armed with a knife, according to the GBI. Investigators believe the shooter received the AR-style gun used in the shooting as a Christmas present from his father.

Summary: Parent fired gun into ground three times while trying to break up fight
Narrative: The East Baton Rouge Sheriff’s Office arrested a man accused of shooting a gun on the campus of Belaire High School. Desmond “Biscuit” Williams, 23, was arrested and booked into the East Baton Rouge Parish Prison on charges of illegal carrying of a firearm on school property and illegal discharge of a firearm. A school administrator at Belaire High School advised EBRSO of a parent stating that Williams, who is a parent of a student at a nearby elementary school, was talking about coming to shoot up the school, according to the sheriff’s office. During an interview with EBRSO, Williams reportedly admitted to being at the school Tuesday with his AR Pistol. He said he shot three times into the ground “as an attempt to de escalate a fight,” according to the sheriff’s office.

Summary: Unidentified person accidentally fired concealed gun during back to school night causing minor injuries
Narrative: Frankfort Police are investigating the accidental firing of a gun at the Frankfort-Schuyler Elementary School on Tuesday evening. Police said it happened around 6 p.m. just as an open-house event was beginning. It was reported by the school resource officer that the firearm was discharged on school property. Police said minor injuries were reported, and the incident is under investigation. There is no threat to the public or students.

Summary: Man fatally shot beside the school, second person wounded
Narrative: Police responded to the 8400 block of Leefield Road around 4:20 p.m. Monday, after reports of shots fired. The school was closed on Monday for the Labor Day holiday. When police arrived, they found Romy Bogier, 43, suffering from a gunshot wound to the upper body. He was taken to a hospital where he was pronounced dead. A second man was taken to a local hospital with non-life-threatening injuries. The victim killed was found near the school dumpster.

Summary: Shots fired during fight in the school parking lot after the football game
Narrative: Police said shots were fired at 9:37 p.m. on Friday, Aug. 30, 2024, after a football game at Romulus Middle School. Several fights broke out as people were leaving the game and officers heard gunshots from the west side of the parking lot. Police said several people ranging in age from 13 to 17 fled the scene before they were located and taken into custody. A handgun was recovered, and investigating officers found spent casings at the initial scene. Rounds had been discharged into the ground.

Summary: Two teens shot during high school football game
Narrative: Witnesses reported hearing at least half a dozen shots echo across the parking lot as the football game against Lenape High School concluded. Investigators said the gunman injured a 15-year-old and a 16-year-old, who were sent to St. Joseph's University Medical Center in Paterson. Both victims were still in the hospital Saturday. They are expected to survive. The 16-year-old suspect was taken into custody Friday night. The Passaic County prosecutor's office has charged the suspect as a juvenile for multiple crimes, including attempted murder. The suspect will be tried in family court. Investigators are still working to uncover and understand a motive.

Summary: Multiple shots fired at business near stadium. Man outside the stadium was struck by a bullet. Crowd heard the shots and evacuated the stadium
Narrative: A man was shot outside the Woodland Hills and Penn Hills high school football game in Turtle Creek at The Wolvarena on Friday night. Turtle Creek Mayor Adam Forgie said the shots were fired at a pharmacy down the street and heard by the crowd at The Wolvarena, the home stadium for Woodland Hills High School. That is when chaos ensued, as spectators began running for the exits. "It did cause the students to freak out, and rightfully so, when they heard the shots," the mayor told KDKA-TV. "And more or less what I understand, it was a stampede of people getting out of the stadium. Right now, everything's OK. Just trying to put all the pieces together." Allegheny County police said the man had left the game and was walking in the area when he heard several shots fired and was hit in the leg. He ran back to the stadium, looking for help, police said. He was taken to the hospital and was later released, according to officials. Multiple ambulances and police vehicles responded to the scene. The game was called in the fourth quarter and the stadium was evacuated.

Summary: Shots fired across from the school following dispute between attendees at high school football game
Narrative: Detectives in Walker County are looking for two people whose argument at a Friday night football game led to shots being fired near the school. No one was hurt, but an unrelated vehicle was shot up. The incident happened at about 10 p.m. last Friday across the street from Ridgeland High School. 3 bullets hit one of the vehicles in the area, a vehicle that had nothing to do with either of the two people arguing.

Summary: Man fired shot that broke the school door
Narrative: At about 12:15 p.m. Monday, damage was discovered to the glass in one of the exterior doors at Craig High School, 401 S. Randall Ave., that was consistent with a bullet striking the door, Sgt. Benjamin Thompson said in a statement. The investigation led to the arrest on Thursday of a 24-year-old Janesville man on tentative charges of criminal damage to property, possess firearm in school zone, and discharge firearm-school zone. The man is being held at the Rock County Jail pending his initial court appearance, Thompson said. There is currently no known threat to the school community or the broader community, Thompson said.

Summary: Football scoreboard shot 4 times by unknown shooter
Narrative: The sheriff’s office said deputies were called at 11:22 a.m. Monday to Wood River High School after it was reported the scoreboard was shot at multiple times between April 5 and Aug. 26 causing $10,000 in damage. The sheriff’s office said four bullet holes were found on the front of the scoreboard.

Summary: Three people shot outside of school during targeted shooting by 4 men
Narrative: On or about August 24, 2024, a shootout (the “Shootout”) occurred in the vicinity of P.S. 396 and Middle School 390 on Andrews Avenue in the Bronx, New York (the “Schools”), during which at least five individuals discharged a total of at least 20 rounds, and at least three people were shot and injured. As depicted on the map below, the Schools are located on Andrews Avenue, with P.S. 396 serving students in pre-kindergarten through fifth grade and Middle School 390 serving students in grades six through eight. The Shootout began with shots fired from a residential building on Andrews Avenue (the “Residential Building”), marked on the map below by a red flag. The Shootout then continued in the middle of Andrews Avenue in front of the Schools.

Summary: Two shot during school event
Narrative: “The Bibb County Sheriff’s office was dispatched Saturday night to the area of Duff Meadows in Brent where there was a class reunion event. My Deputies as well as multiple other in county agencies responded including West Blocton, Woodstock, Brent and Centreville. Upon arrival multiple vehicles were found to have been shot and 2 gunshot victims. One victim was shot in the arm another shot in the head. Both victims are recovering at home. At this time one arrest has been made in connection with the shooting."

Summary: Student was shot during a back to school event and basketball game at the stadium
Narrative: The shooting happened around 4:15 p.m. in a parking lot in the 10300 block of South Cottage Grove near the Gately Park Stadium, which is located at 810 E. 103rd St. in Pullman near Roseland, Chicago police said. Witnesses told ABC7 the shooting happened during a back-to-school event. There was a basketball game going on during the event, and after it wrapped up crowds of teens started to gather in the parking lot. A 15-year-old boy was standing among the crowd in the parking lot when he was approached by a white vehicle and someone inside began to fire shots at him, police said. One witness who rendered aid on scene told ABC7 the teenager was arguing with a person in a white SUV before the shots were fired and the SUV drove off. The teen victim was shot in the abdomen, police said. He was taken to Comer Children's Hospital, where he was initially reported to be in serious condition.

Summary: Teen fatally shot himself at the school district administrative office
Narrative: Officers initially responded to the scene at 12:50 p.m. Tuesday at the 300 block of Goetz Avenue near the Hancock Place School District's central administration office, which doubles as an early childhood center. There, they found the teen suffering from a self inflicted gunshot injury, who was later pronounced dead at the scene.

Summary: Police fatally shot an adult man on campus before classes started
Narrative: Police fatally shot an unidentified man on campus before classes started. Sports teams were practicing at the time of the shooting and went on lockdown. Classes were cancelled for the day. The man killed by police was identified as a retired FBI agent.

Summary: Man in body armor with guns, knives, and bear spray threatened to shoot bus driver for blocking intersection during student pick-up
Narrative: A man in Baton Rouge is in jail after police said he threatened a school bus full of children while carrying a gun and wearing body armor, according to WBRZ. Baton Rouge police said Duane Landry harassed parents, students, and the bus driver as kids loaded the bus on Monday and Tuesday morning. Landry was mad that the bus driver was blocking an intersection, police said. They said he tried to get on the bus while wearing body armor with guns, knives, and a can of bear spray. He then threatened to shoot the bus driver, our partners reported. Arrested for violating Gun Free School Zone.

Summary: School bus was shot with pellets after dropping students off
Narrative: School bus was shot with pellets after dropping students off. No injuries reported.

Summary: Man shot during fight in the school parking lot during spirit night
Narrative: The shooting occurred in a stadium parking lot behind the school during a school spirit night Monday (Aug. 19), authorities said. The sheriff’s office says a fight broke out between Anthony Hughes, 43, and a group of juveniles. The suspected shooter, Marcus Kelly, 32, reportedly got out of his car and shot Hughes once in the torso while Hughes was fighting with one of the juveniles, who was riding in Kelly’s car. Both men then jumped in their cars and headed onto Bearkat Drive, when the sheriff’s office says Hughes rammed Kelly’s car after it was stopped by a deputy. Officials were able to detain Hughes and Kelly and take possession of the gun. The fire department took both men to the hospital for treatment.
Accomplice_Narrative: Shooter was driving teen involved in fight

Summary: Shots fired outside school, two juveniles arrested with a firearm
Narrative: A Natomas Unified School District campus was placed on lockdown Monday after Sacramento police were called to investigate a report of gunshots heard in the area, according to law enforcement and archived audio dispatch calls. Officers were called about 2:45 p.m. to the 3400 block of Fong Ranch Road after school officials called police, reporting hearing several gunshots ringing out in the area. The area includes Discovery High School as well as Natomas High School. There weren't any injuries reported, said Officer Cody Tapley, a spokesman for the Sacramento Police Department, but he said investigators found “evidence” of a shooting. Two juveniles were detained in connection to the incident, Tapley said. A firearm was also recovered, he said.

Summary: Student fired dozen shots in front of the school at dismissal
Narrative: Student fired dozen shots at students outside the school during dismissal. All of the shots missed. The shooter fled and was arrested off campus. School went on lockdown and security was increased the following day.

Summary: Two 16-year-olds shot on the school track
Narrative: A 16-year-old was killed and another was critically wounded during a targeted shooting on the school track. Police recovered 8 shell casings at the school. Shooter fled.

Summary: School bus carrying children home was struck by bullets
Narrative: According to officials, Bus 899 was caught in the crossfire of gunshots being exchanged between two individuals, but the school bus was not the intended target. The bus driver was able to move out of harm’s way to get the students to safety.

Summary: Student brandished gun during fight in hallway
Narrative: Student brandished gun during a fight in the hallway. Student was arrested and a firearm was seized while school went on lockdown.

Summary: Man fired shots into the air outside the football stadium causing crowd to flee
Narrative: Man fired shots into the air from a vehicle outside the football stadium causing crowd to flee during the third quarter. Remainder of game was cancelled.

Summary: Unidentified person shot in the school parking lot
Narrative: A person who sustained accidental self-inflicted wounds in a hand may face charges pending an investigation, police said. Galax Police were called Sunday afternoon to Galax High School, where they found the driver who had sustained the wounds while attempting to store the gun inside a vehicle. Police did not reveal the person’s name, age or gender. The person was attending a non school-related event on school property, police said.

Summary: Student shot in front of the school during a fight at dismissal
Narrative: Student shot during fight at dismissal. Campus went on lockdown. Minor arrested.

Summary: Two students were shooting replica guns at other students, SRO found real gun during search
Narrative: Two teenagers in Castle Rock who police say shot water beads at people outside a high school with a toy gun are facing charges. School resource officers who responded to the disturbance outside Castle View High School in Colorado late Friday morning said they found a real, unloaded gun in the vehicle of the teens after they began questioning them.

Summary: Parent shot during youth soccer camp, summer students went on lockdown
Narrative: One person is injured after a shooting at Modoc Field in Klamath Falls Tuesday. According to Klamath Falls City Schools the shooting happened on the bridge at Modoc Field. The victim was a parent attending a youth soccer camp at Klamath Union High School and was taken to the hospital for treatment. All students on campus were placed on lockdown. The Klamath Falls Police Department is currently investigating the incident. According to a Facebook post, the department says there is no suspect in custody, but there is also no threat to the public.

Summary: Man shot during robbery inside vehicle that crashed through fence and onto the school's football field
Narrative: At around 3 a.m., the Oklahoma City Police Department responded to the field at Southeast High School. When they arrived on the scene, police found that the driver of that vehicle had been shot. Before the shooting, the driver picked up a woman. When she demanded money and the driver refused to give it to her, she shot him, according to police. Shooter fled before police arrived. Victim was transported in critical condition.

Summary: Two teens shot on school basketball court
Narrative: Two teens were shot during a drive-by shooting while playing basketball at the school.

Summary: Man fatally shot in vehicle in school parking lot
Narrative: A man is dead after being found shot in a Louisville elementary school parking lot. According to officials, they were called Friday afternoon to the 5800 block of Greenwood Road, outside Greenwood Elementary, in Pleasure Ridge Park. Police said they were originally called for reports of a crash, but when they arrived, they found someone with a gunshot wound. They said the man was rushed to a hospital where he died.

Summary: Man fired shots and threatened two staff members, tackled by janitor
Narrative: A 76-year-old Foxworth man was arrested and charged Thursday with two counts of kidnapping and making a terroristic threat after brandishing an air pistol Thursday morning at West Marion Primary School. The Marion County Sheriff’s Office said that Timothy Ward was in custody at the Marion County Jail. MCSO said that Ward entered the school about 7:20 a.m. Thursday as staff were arriving at work. According to the school district’s website, no students were on campus. The school year officially does not start until Monday. Staff immediately recognized that Ward did not belong and attempted to escort him back outside, MCSO said. MCSO said Ward then brandished a firearm in his waistband, and held two staff members against their wills. When approached again, Ward pointed the firearm at another staff member, MCSO said. An active shooter call to 911 was made at about 7:24 a.m. Marion County Sheriff Berkley Hall said the staff members quickly worked to de-escalate the situation, and a janitor was able to subdue the shooter until law enforcement arrived. The janitor held Ward until 7:27 am, when Marion County School District Police arrived and placed him in custody. “We had, I guess you would say, a responsible custodian (who) saw what was happening and got involved and actually took the suspect down right before the school resource officers arrived,” Hall said.

Summary: Police shot a man who was removing his clothing during a fight with officers outside the school
Narrative: Aiken County deputies confronted an unstable man stripping his clothes Thursday afternoon near J.D. Lever Elementary School, causing a physical battle that resulted in the suspect being shot and injuries to an officer. No one at the Aiken school was harmed, but the building was placed on lockdown before deputies oversaw the safe release to parents and school buses, sheriff’s Capt. Eric Abdullah said. A large police presence helped with the investigation and security at the school. The incident began around 2 p.m. Thursday when they got a report of a suspect acting erratically on Columbia Highway North near Beaver Dam Road. Deputies found the man on a driveway beside J.D. Lever Elementary School, where he was taking off his clothes. During the interaction between the man and two deputies, the suspect began fighting in a long back-and-forth battle. “At one point, one of the deputies was knocked to the ground and injured and the suspect was shot,” Capt. Abdullah said. The suspect was taken by Aiken County EMS to the hospital while another officer transported the injured male deputy to the the hospital for treatment.

Summary: Woman found shot in school parking lot
Narrative: Woman found shot in the school parking lot. Shooter fled before police arrived.

Summary: Man fired shot a school police officer in the school district office parking lot
Narrative: That’s when the suspect exited the passenger side of the SUV, armed with a handgun. He walked to the rear of the patrol car, raised the pistol and fired into the vehicle as the officer sped away, Tacoma Police spokesperson Detective William Muse said. The shot narrowly missed the School Patrol Officer,” Tacoma Police said in a statement. After the shooting, the suspect fled the scene in the SUV. “It is believed that the motive behind the shooting was due to the School Patrol Officer prohibiting an illegal narcotics transaction between the occupants of the vehicle and people loitering on school property,” the release said. Prosecutors gave these additional details about the shooting in charging documents: Tacoma Police Department officers responded to 600 South 8th St. at about 1:48 p.m. on July 18. The patrol officer said he drove his marked patrol vehicle into the western parking lot of the school administration building after speaking with three people in the southern stairwell of the school administration building about their narcotics activity.

Summary: Amazon prime day delivery driver opened fire during a parking dispute with a school bus driver and school staff.
Narrative: This all started when police say a school bus driver was unable to make a turn due to a parked Amazon van. Officials tell Action News the aide on the bus got out and asked one of the delivery drivers to move. That's when an altercation ensued and at some point, shots were fired by the driver. Action News has learned that school staff tried to intervene, but the suspect still fired at least three shots. No injuries were reported. Police say the school bus was full of children transporting campers. The students were able to take shelter inside the nearby Edwin M. Stanton School.

Summary: Shots fired outside school, police recovered shell casings
Narrative: Officers were called to Winburn and Pennebaker around 9 p.m. Tuesday night. That’s next to Winburn Middle School. They found shell casings there. No injuries or property damage were reported.

Summary: Two adults shot after vigil for three former students killed in car crash
Narrative: Officers said they were at Wise High School in the 12600 block of Brooke Lane earlier in the evening for a vigil for three athletes who died in a crash last week. Shortly after leaving the vigil, officers heard shots and quickly turned around to respond to the scene around 10 p.m. Once on the scene, officers were flagged down by citizens performing life-saving measures on a woman who was suffering from gunshot wounds. Officers also found a man on the scene suffering from gunshot wounds. Both were taken to a hospital where the man was pronounced dead. The woman's injuries are considered non-life-threatening, officials said. A gun was recovered outside, according to officers. The vigil was being held for Kyhree Jackson, Anthony Lytton, Jr. and Isaiah Hazel who all played football together at the high school.

Summary: Student robbed at gunpoint inside bathroom during summer classes
Narrative: Student was robbed at gunpoint by a teen inside the school bathroom during summer classes. High school and nearby middle school went on lockdown. Shooter fled and was arrested the following week.

Summary: Ex-spouse of an employee fired a shot outside the athletic facility
Narrative: According to Greenville ISD, the shooting happened at 1:33 p.m. The suspect arrived at the Roy Q Traylor Athletic Facility and attempted to shoot their ex-spouse, who works as a coach and staff member at the school, according to the district. The suspect fired a single shot, but missed, according to the district's release. After the gunshot, the school went on lockdown. Greenville ISD Police say the suspect is still at-large, and as a result, there will be an increased security presence throughout the summer. Greenville ISD says no students were on campus, and that all student workouts were finished by noon. School went on lockdown and will have extra security for the remainder of the summer.

Summary: Bystander man killed when 40 shots were fired during fight on the front lawn of the school
Narrative: 33-year-old man was fatally shot during later fight involving 20-30 people in the front lawn of the school. Approximately 100 shots were fired. Bullets also struck vehicles and went through the walls of nearby homes. Victim was a bystander.

Summary: Man fatally shot in front of the school
Narrative: Man fatally shot in front of the school.

Summary: Man wearing camo and tactical vest with replica airsoft rifle was "practicing tactical moves" and firing shots at the school
Narrative: A Rochester man was arrested for allegedly “practice(ing) his tactical moves” and shooting at a Rochester school Sunday. Jakob Barrows, 20, faces recommended charges of using a BB gun/replica firearm on school property; carrying a BB gun/assault weapon in public; weapons–BB Gun/replica firearm on school property; and disorderly conduct. According to Rochester police at about 11:30 p.m. June 30, Rochester police learned a man was wearing a mask and carrying what looked like an AK47 at the Tom Kadlec Kia on Highway 52. As Rochester police responded to Highway 52, dispatch received another call that a staff member at Rochester Arts and Sciences Academy could see a man wearing camouflage and carrying a rifle in front of the school.

Summary: Man shot on school playground
Narrative: Adult man shot on the school playground. Shooter fled before police arrived. No children were in the area when the shooting happened.

Summary: Teen playing with water gun was shot by a teen with a real gun outside the school
Narrative: A redacted incident report from RCSD said the shooting occurred shortly after 6 p.m. Friday behind Bridge Creek Elementary School on Bombing Range Road. The teen who was shot arrived at Bridge Creek with a group to play with water guns, the department stated. Deputies told WIS News 10 they were trying to have fun in the heat and that there were no summer activities going on at the school at the time of the shooting. While they were playing, another group of unknown individuals showed up and attacked the teenager. As the teenager and his group fled the scene, the suspects fired shots and struck the victim in the lower body, according to the incident report.

Summary: Man fired shot hitting occupied school bus during police chase
Narrative: Man fired shot during police pursuit striking school bus with children on board. Man fled and was arrested the next morning. No students or staff were injured.

Summary: Man fired shots at three people fishing in the pod at the school
Narrative: A 23-year-old Berks County man was arrested and charged earlier this month after a group of people fishing in Lancaster County said he shot several rounds in their direction while on an ATV, causing bullets to skip off the nearby pond right past them, according to an affidavit of probable cause. An officer with the Northern Lancaster County Regional Police Department responded to the area of Doe Run Elementary School around 1:15 p.m. on June 15, where multiple witnesses said they heard the gunshots. Three of the witnesses said they were fishing at a pond to the east of the school when they saw Moore on the four-wheeler moments before bullets skipped off the surface of the pond in their direction, landing on both sides of one individual, the affidavit said. The trio believed they were being shot at purposefully, prompting them to lay down in the grass near the pond, police said. In a police interview a few hours later, Moore confirmed he fired the rounds and said he shot about “a clip and a half,” somewhere between 16 and 18 rounds according to police, the affidavit said.

Summary: Man killed and child wounded in the bleachers during shooting at football game
Narrative: Officers found the unidentified adult man "suffering from a gunshot wound(s)" and rushed him to the hospital, where he was later pronounced dead, according to the PGCPD. A 5-year-old child was also wounded in the incident, police said. "The child was driven to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries," the PGCPD said in a statement. Police said that the shooting stemmed from an argument during the event, which was a non-profit fundraiser and not sponsored by the school.

Summary: Teen shot in parking garage outside off-campus graduation ceremony
Narrative: Investigators said the 18-year-old woman was shot after graduating from the Boston Collaborative High School in Dorchester earlier in the day. The ceremony was held at the Institute of Contemporary Art. "This is a travesty. This should not happen. High school students attending a graduation on a beautiful day like today shouldn't have had that day marked with a shooting taking place and a young woman having to go to the hospital," Suffolk County District Attorney Kevin Hayden said. Witnesses said they knew something was wrong when they saw graduates in their caps and gowns running. "We believe that this was not a random event," Boston police Commissioner Michael Cox said. Boston police said the woman's injuries were non-life-threatening, and she was taken to a hospital.

Summary: Teen shot in school parking lot during drive-by shooting
Narrative: 15-year-old teen was shot in the school parking lot during a drive-by shooting. Shooter fled. Citizens transported the teen to the hospital. Gunshot detection system recorded 13 shots fired.

Summary: Man wearing ninja costume with sword and pistol fired shot outside school while voting was taking place inside
Narrative: Dispatchers were reportedly told one shot was fired near the school by the suspect, later identified as Akins. He was also described as wearing an “all-black ninja style costume, wielding a sword with a revolver-type handgun in his waistband.” School officials also told police the shot was fired within 75 feet of the location, causing it to go on lockdown. According to a police report obtained by WMBF News, officers with the Horry County Police Department were called to Nichols Highway at around 12:30 p.m. after reports of a shot being fired. Public information shows the only polling place on the road was Midland Elementary School.

Summary: Shots fired during large fight in school parking lot
Narrative: Large group of 100 teens were in the school parking lot when a fight started. One person fired shots into the air. At least four people were armed with handguns at the school. Shooter and crowd fled before police arrived.

Summary: School employee shot themselves during School Guardian training session at police gun range
Narrative: The accidental discharge occurred at the Palm Beach Sheriff’s Office’s gun range during "School Guardian" training program for armed staff. The individual involved in the shooting was taking a civilian training exercise with the Palm Beach County School District. The victim was transported to a local hospital with a gunshot wound to the hip area, and the injuries are non-life-threatening. "During a training exercise this morning at the PBSO gun range, a School District employee inadvertently discharged their firearm and was impacted by a self-inflicted wound. They were transported to an area hospital for evaluation and treatment. Injuries were non-life threatening."

Summary: Shot fired inside a classroom, student fled
Narrative: A loud bang heard Friday afternoon at Carson High School was from a gun that discharged inside a classroom with students present, according to Los Angeles school officials, who updated a previous release stating that no shot had been fired. No injuries were reported. The district did not say where the gun was located when it discharged. A student ran out of the classroom and off-campus immediately after a “loud bang.”

Summary: Shots fired from two vehicles during dismissal, students went back inside to lockdown
Narrative: Two people exchanged gunfire outside of Kansas City Public Schools’ East High School as summer classes were dismissing Thursday afternoon, a police spokesman said. No one was injured when the gunfire erupted about 2:30 p.m. in front of the high school.

Summary: Man fired 8 shots from his vehicle outside the school causing multi-campus lockdown
Narrative: Man fired 8 shots from his vehicle outside the school causing multi-campus lockdown. Man fled and was later arrested for assault with a deadly weapon and brandishing a firearm in a school zone.

Summary: Student fatally shot during fight in the parking lot at lunch
Narrative: Around 12:45 p.m. police said on the social platform X that officers were investigating a shooting at an address matching that of the high school. Officers found the student with multiple gunshot wounds. Garfield was temporarily placed in lockdown, and two nearby schools were ordered to shelter in place, officials said. Detectives learned that before the shooting, the 17-year-old tried to break up an altercation between the shooting suspect and another person. After walking away, the suspect approached the 17-year-old and shot him, Deputy Chief Eric Barden told The Seattle Times. The suspect, said to be male and of high school age, fled and has not been located, police said. It was not clear if he is also a student at Garfield.

Summary: Student in ski mask entered classroom with replica AR-15 air rifle and opened fire
Narrative: Just 30 minutes earlier, according to the SPD report and a person familiar with the situation, a teacher and students in their class were horrified to be in the middle of the first moments of an apparent school shooting after a student raced into a classroom wearing a ski mask and armed with what appeared to be an automatic rifle. The student opened fire. The teacher later told police they expected to die. According to the SPD report on the incident, the teacher told police they were assisting students with a project when another student entered the classroom that Thursday around noon seeking the teacher’s assistance. The teacher said the student became angered and began yelling when they told the student he would have to wait. The student left, the teacher said. Moments later, he burst back into the room, this time wearing a ski mask and carrying the rifle. According to the SPD report, the student opened fire on the teacher, holding down the trigger “for 10 – 15 seconds nonstop.” The realistic looking gun was an air rifle and police say the teacher reported being struck by multiple rubber bullets. The student, according to the SPD brief, “then left the classroom without saying anything.” Before the bullets hit, the teacher said they thought the gun was real and thought they were going to die. In the chaotic moments that followed, police and emergency vehicles would swarm the campus — but not for a classroom shooting. Outside, police say Murphy-Paine was shot and killed while trying to break up a fight. Though the teacher reported the air rifle assault and talked to police the next day, the earlier, apparently unrelated classroom incident was not included in reports on the deadly shooting.

Summary: Man fired multiple shots during a dispute with two adults in front of the school
Narrative: Man on a scooter fired multiple shots at two victims during a dispute in front of the school. Man fled and was arrested on charges of attempted murder, display of a firearm while committing a felony, exhibition of a firearm on school property and unlawful discharge of a firearm in a public place.

Summary: Police shoot a man armed with a large knife outside the school
Narrative: Police officers shot an 18-year-old man armed with a knife outside the school when the man refused to comply with commands to drop the weapon. The man's father said he was suffering from severe mental illness.

Summary: Student was found fatally shot in the school parking lot
Narrative: Multiple officers were dispatched at about 11:10 a.m. to an aid call for an unconscious man in the parking lot, according to a June 3 Kent Police news release. The 911 caller said the man had significant bleeding and might be deceased. Officers and Puget Sound Fire personnel arrived at the same time and located the man with an injury to the back of his head, consistent with a gunshot wound, according to police. He was already dead. Detectives responded to the scene and are investigating the circumstances surrounding Zelaya’s death.

Summary: Man fired shots after school staff member saw him attempting to steal catalytic converter from vehicle parked at the school
Narrative: Police said two men were trying to steal a catalytic converter from a blue Toyota Prius parked outside the Jesuit rectory at Taylor and Morgan streets shortly before 6 a.m., when 74-year-old Fr. Jeremiah Lynch S.J, heard the noises. Saint Ignatius College Prep Director of Communications Kristyn Hartman – a former CBS 2 reporter – said Fr. Lynch opened the door and peeped his head outside to see what was happening. "He saw somebody under the car. He heard the noise, and he said, 'Hey, what are you doing?"  Hartman said, "and one of them – or both of them, I'm not certain of that – pulled a gun and started shooting; shot three times. 'Bam, bam, bam.'" The shooter or shooters were aiming for Fr. Lynch, Hartman said. She said the priest suffered some kind of an injury when the shots were fired, but its nature is not clear.

Summary: Two girls shot on playground when at least two people started firing shots
Narrative: Shots were fired shortly after 9 p.m. near P.S. 178 on Dean Street. Police said the 9 and 11-year-old girls were playing in the middle of a field, as their mothers watched from a nearby park bench. Six rounds were fired in the children's direction, hitting the 9-year-old in the leg and the 11-year-old in the back, police said. They were rushed by their mothers to Brookdale Hospital, where they are listed in stable condition and expected to survive. Detectives have been canvassing the scene for a description of the suspects and which way they took off. Based on the bullet casings found at the scene, investigators believe there were multiple shooters. There were possibly two shooters that fired at least six rounds in the direction the children were playing.

Summary: Man shot during late night party on campus after graduation
Narrative: A shooting during a large party hours after the Arthur Hill High School graduation early Friday left a man with non-life-threatening injuries. Michigan State Police say authorities were dispersing a large party, which assembled after the graduation ceremony Thursday night. Police heard a volley of gunshots as several vehicles were leaving the area around 12:40 a.m. Investigators found a 21-year-old man suffering from a gunshot wound. He was taken to an area hospital for treatment of non-life-threatening injuries, but his condition was not available Friday morning. Police say they have identified a suspect, who had not been arrested by Friday morning.

Summary: Two teens shot on basketball court behind school
Narrative: Two teenagers were inadvertently shot when gunfire erupted behind a Queens school Wednesday, authorities said. The boy and girl, both 15, were struck on a basketball court in the back of a school at 441 Beach 51st St. in Edgemere at around 4:15 p.m., according to the NYPD. The girl was shot in her leg and arm, and a boy was shot in the leg, police said. The victims, who were not the intended targets, were taken to the hospital for treatment. Police are searching for two gunmen, one fled on a CitiBike, and the other on a metal kick scooter, police said. There have been no arrests.

Summary: Two men fired shot outside on school property while tagging the school building with gang graffiti
Narrative: Two men fired shot outside on school property while tagging the school building with gang graffiti.

Summary: Shots fired near the baseball field during afternoon classes, school went on lockdown
Narrative: Police recovered multiple shell casings near the baseball field after shots were fired during afternoon classes. Shooter fled in a vehicle before police arrived. No injuries.

Summary: Shots fired during fight at high school graduation ceremony
Narrative: 22-year-old brother of a student fired shots during fight outside of the Knapp Center after Des Moines police said officers heard gunfire. He was armed with 3 firearms. No one was injured. Several officers with the Des Moines Police Department were already at the Knapp Center due to Roosevelt High School's graduation ceremony, which was going on inside. Des Moines police said officers heard gunfire around 5:35 p.m. outside of the Knapp Center. Investigators say a handgun was found on one suspect, while a second one was found in one of their vehicles. "People outside started running inside, we presume, to get shelter," said Sgt. Paul Parizek, with the Des Moines Police Department. "That got people inside excited and concerned. They started running outside." Police said they were able to lock down the area quickly, thanks to the police already present. Following the gunshots, Des Moines police said a fight involving more than five individuals broke out inside the arena. Pepper spray was used to break up the fight.

Summary: Teen fatally shot man during dispute in school parking lot
Narrative: According to authorities, they received a call Friday afternoon from a Gadsden High School security guard and witnesses about a man lying on the road. Law enforcement believes this could be a case of road rage as witnesses told them a young suspect and the victim-- an older man-- drove into the high school parking lot for what appeared to be a confrontation that ended with the young suspect fatally shot the victim.

Summary: Man fired multiple shots striking school while students were outside for field day
Narrative: The Clark County Sheriff's Office arrested a man on Friday after they say he shot at an animal near a school, with some of the ammunition hitting school property. Police were called to Henryville School Friday morning during its field day about possible gunshots. There were more than a dozen deputies and officers on the scene, with the school going on a soft lockdown. Following the CCSO's investigation, police arrested a man who lives near the school. Police said the man shot at an animal with a shotgun, and some of the pellets hit school property. No students at the school were harmed during the shooting. The man was arrested and charged with criminal recklessness with a firearm.

Summary: Man shot school windows with pellet gun
Narrative: Man shot school windows with pellet gun.

Summary: Two people shot one the school basketball court
Narrative: On Thursday, May 23, 2024, at 9:39 p.m., Cambridge Police responded to Donnelly Field located at 91 Berkshire Street for reports of multiple gunshots. The preliminary investigation indicates that the defendant was at the basketball court when he was approached by multiple individuals. Following a brief interaction an exchange of gunfire occurred.  During this exchange the defendant allegedly discharged a firearm and was also shot by one of those individuals. A 22-year-old female victim was also located in the basketball courts suffering from a gunshot wound believed to be from a stray bullet fired by one of the unknown parties.

Summary: 8th grader was leaving the school with his aunt when he was shot in the field next to the school
Narrative: 8th grader was leaving the school with his aunt when he was shot in the field next to the school. Shooter fled.

Summary: Three adults shot during fight at the graduation ceremony
Narrative: According to police, two groups of people got into a fight in the school parking lot. The altercation escalated and multiple people were struck by gunfire. OPD officers detained multiple individuals and arrested one adult. Investigators, police say, are actively looking for additional shooters and witnesses. The shooting happened just before 7:45 p.m., per OPD. Police have indicated that there is no ongoing danger to the community. According to witnesses, the shots were heard after the ceremony ended, prompting people to run for safety. There was a heavy police presence at the school following the shooting. OPD said California Highway Patrol responded to assist.

Summary: Student shot in the school parking lot at dismissal
Narrative: Student was shot during dismissal on the last day of school near the exit to the school parking lot. 17-year-old student fled and was arrested off campus with a gun.

Summary: Man killed outside school during end of year awards ceremony
Narrative: Before the end of year awards at the school, the father of a student and the romantic partner of the student's mother got into a physical dispute in the parking lot about who was taking the child home. Father was shot multiple times and died at the scene. Other man surrendered and waited for police to arrive. Multiple students and parents witnessed the shooting. Event was cancelled.

Summary: Ten shots fired near the football field during game
Narrative: Ten shots fired near the football field during the name. High school is located in a rural area without any businesses or public places near the location of the shooting. Police responded for "active shooter" including bring the SWAT team APC vehicle to the school. No victims. Shooter fled and was not identified.

Summary: Student shot in the face outside the school
Narrative: 13-year-old student is in critical condition after being shot in the face outside Alger Middle in Grand Rapids, MI at noon yesterday. A sixth grader at Alger Middle School (MI) heard screams from outside then looked through her classroom window to see a bloodied classmate on a bench. “I was crying,” the 11-year-old girl said. “Like, this has never happened before.” There was “blood everywhere,” she said. School went on Code Red Lockdown for 30 minutes with students barricading and hiding inside classrooms. Parents were notified about the lockdown and raced to the school. Police determined the shooting took place in Alger Park, a recreational area owned and operated by the Grand Rapid School District. A 9mm handgun was recovered in the park. It's unclear how and why the two students were outside because the school does not have outdoor lunch or recess. Mother of the victim stated the shooting was an accident and the two 8th graders involved were playing with the gun.

Summary: Two people shot during fight at graduation ceremony
Narrative: At 2:33 p.m. on Sunday, May 19, the Cape Girardeau Police Department received multiple calls regarding gunfire inside the Show Me Center. According to the police department, two people were shot, and both were taken to the hospital for non-life-threatening injuries. A person of interest is currently in custody but names are not being released at this time. The Cape Central High School Graduation was being held at this location on Sunday afternoon. No students or staff members were injured. They were able to get out of the building safely with the help of staff members at the Show Me Center.

Summary: Adult man pointed gun and damaged car with baton during road rage dispute in school parking lot after graduation
Narrative: According to Spartanburg School District Two, friends and family were at the school to witness 604 students graduate from the high school. Following the ceremony, as cars were filing out of the parking lot, officials said a road rage incident took place where a man caused damage to a victim’s car by hitting it with a baton. Arrest warrants said the man then pulled out a gun and pointed it at more than one person not in self-defense. Deputies have since charged the man, later identified as 52-year-old John David Kanipe, with carrying a weapon on school property, two counts of pointing a firearm at a person and malicious injury to personal property,

School: De La Salle Charter High School
Summary: Shots fired during fight between two groups at graduation
Narrative: Shots fired during fight between two groups at graduation.

Summary: Student fatally shot during large gathering in the parking lot after graduation
Narrative: An 18-year-old was killed hours after graduating from Withrow High School. Large group of students were in the parking lot of the high school when 30-40 shots were fired. Victim was shot in the chest and neck, he died at the hospital. Shooter fled.

Summary: Man pointed gun at vendor and threatened him about debt during school event
Narrative: Man pointed gun at vendor and threatened him about debt during school event. No shots fired. Man arrested for aggravated menacing and possession of a deadly weapon in a school safety zone, according to the district.

Summary: Student shot by unknown man with pellet gun while outside for recess
Narrative: Student shot by unknown man with pellet gun while outside for recess. Students were moved inside the building and the school locked down. Shooter fled.

School: McKenzie Career Center of Innovation and Technology
